Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Pardgroup S.p.A, società leader operante nei settori del Marketing Operativo sulla GDO/GDS, dei Servizi Retail e delle vendite, in ottica di potenziamento del proprio organico, ricerca una figura di Business Intelligence Analyst da inserire in organico.


La risorsa, inserita all’interno della divisione Business Intelligence, dovrà svolgere le seguenti attività:

  • Analisi dati provenienti dal field e dal cliente;
  • Aggregazione dati, individuando le metodologie di analisi più idonee;
  • Progettazione Dashboard in Tableau e costruzione di Dataset;
  • Interpretazione del dato e analisi critica dello stesso;
  • Predisposizione di presentazioni relative alle analisi eseguite.


Il/la candidato/a ideale possiede i seguenti requisiti:

  • Precedente esperienza almeno di 1/2 anni in ruolo analogo;
  • Laurea ad indirizzo tecnico/scientifico;
  • Eccellente conoscenza di Excel;.
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Buona conoscenza di almeno un tool di ETL (in particolar modo Prep);
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e di problem solving


Nice to have: conoscenza di Tableau e del linguaggio SQL


Completano il profilo attitudine nella gestione del cliente e spiccate capacità relazionali e comunicative.


"Pardgroup Spa informa che la ricerca è rivolta ai candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). Ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento 679/2016 (GDPR) i dati sensibili e particolari comunicati dal candidato tramite l'invio del CV sono raccolti e trattati secondo quanto indicato nella normativa privacy accessibile al seguente link (https://www.pardgroup.com/privacy-policy) e per quanto occorrer possa, con l'invio dello stesso CV, il candidato ne autorizza il trattamento"

Title: Strategy, Insight & Analytics Intern
Description:
About The Job

For our Strategy & Insight team in Milan we are looking as of now for a Strategy, Insight & Analytics Intern.

During your internship you’ll be part of a dynamic team and you’ll have visibility on all the company’s departments and you’ll contribute to the achievements of your team.

About The Job

You’ll collaborate with several company’s departments (Sales, Trade Marketing & Category, Marketing and Supply Chain) to develop your analytical skills and to discover competitive dynamics of fresh dairy products’ market.

In details, you’ll be involved on


Critical analysis to understand the market’s dynamics and competitors;
Sales and market trends analysis and consumers’ behavior analysis (based on IRI database);
Support on projects based on qualitative and quantitative researches;
Management of relationships with analysis agencies and stakeholders;


About you

To be able to achieve the above and be successful in this role, we believe you need to have


Master’s degree in Economics or Marketing or Management Engineering;
Problem solving and entrepreneurial thinking;
Structured and analytical way of working;
Relational skills and flexibility;
Previous international and/or internship experience will be a plus;
Excel and Power Point knowledge;
Fluent in English.


About Us

About us

As a world leading food company DANONE stands for international success. Around 104000 employees work on all five continents in the three Danone business areas Essential Dairy & Plant-Based, Specialized Nutrition and Water on one corporate mission “Bringing health through food to as many people as possible”.

We want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people must impact the world through their daily choices. Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in. We believe a healthy body needs healthy food and healthy food needs a healthy planet this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.

Do things your way. The way you work, the way you develop, the way you progress, it’s all up to you.

Working here you’ll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities. You’ll work with some of the best-known brands in the world and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself.

Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU.

We offer

We believe in a “Phygital” workplace.

Physical because our offices are centrally located and easily reached by public transportation. Free water, yogurt and fruits are of course benefits for our employees.

Digital as we work for objectives, without time or space constraints, in a responsible, autonomous and flexible way that helps to reconcile life and work times, improving productivity and focusing on results.

We offer you a culture, where you’ll be welcomed to bring in ideas and take initiative. You’ll learn from colleagues highly committed and passionate about what they do. We believe in learning something new each day as it means you keep growing every day!

We believe everyone has talent, something which comes natural to you. Your uniqueness is something which brings both excellence as well as energizes you.

In Italy we are Certified Great Place to Work and B Corp.

Inclusive Diversity

Danone is committed to create and live an inclusive & diverse environment, which will drive our growth as a business, as teams, as members of communities & as individuals. Valuing diversity is recognizing and respecting human differences and similarities. Our aim is to ensure that all employees and applicants are given equal opportunity and that our organization is representative of our consumers and society.

We commit to foster an inclusive working environment where we celebrate all types of diversity, both visible and invisible, which includes age, race, gender, nationality, disability, background, education, religion, beliefs, thinking style, perspectives and sexual orientation.

We believe that our differences will make the difference.

Your personal data will be processed in compliance with the EU Regulation 2016/679.

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Primary Location

Belgium-Brussels

NATO Body

NATO International Staff (NATO IS)

Schedule

Full-time

Application Deadline

20-Apr-2025, 11:59:00 PM

Salary (Pay Basis)

6,467.30

Grade

NATO Grade G15


SUMMARY



NATO’s Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO’s public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO’s work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Unit develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. They are responsible for applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of multiple publicly and commercially available data sources and services. Additionally, the incumbent produces analytical products with actionable recommendations, supporting data-driven decision making and helping to ensure a strategic approach to PDD’s multifaceted communications. They also help to shape the acquisition and adoption of cutting-edge analytical tools to help NATO’s IEA capability evolve.


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE



Essential

The incumbent must:


possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role (preferably such as data science or international relations);
have 2 years of professional experience in data analytics, and qualitative and quantitative research methods;
possess proven experience applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media;
possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences;
be able to explain data as a convincing story;
have excellent communication, drafting and oral presentation skills;
demonstrate sound political judgment;
have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization;
possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one; I (“Beginner”) in the other.



DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:


experience with quantitative methods and their application to trend analysis;
experience with natural language processing;
basic knowledge of programming languages, such as Python;
geographic expertise (Russia, China or/and Middle East North Africa);
experience with methods and techniques to evaluate and assess communications activities, including relevant measurement and assessment frameworks and tools;
knowledge of and/or experience in analysing information threats, using publicly and commercially available data sources and services to characterize threat actors’ campaigns, capabilities, and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs);
knowledge of and/or experience in implementing best-practice analytical methodologies to structure and scale data models for analysing information threats.
MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES



Information Management

Contribute in an active, timely and well-coordinated manner to PDD’s work in the area of Information Environment Assessment, by delivering high quality reports including actionable recommendations based on the assessment of the information environment. Glean and share insights with PDD leadership on information threats targeting NATO.

Knowledge Management

Keep abreast of industry developments relevant to Information Environment Assessment, including emerging best practice analytical methodologies. Provide clear insight and recommendations to civilian and military staffs from multiple disciplines, including those directly responsible for analysing and evaluating information and communications products. Ensure that this expertise is translated into effective Information Environment Assessments reporting. Use sound political judgement when making recommendations on adjusting NATO’s communications based on regular analysis and assessment.

Expertise Development

Apply data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media. Contribute to improving the quality, scope and operational relevance of the IEA reports delivered by PDD. Identify and analyse trends, and distil actionable insights to brief NATO communicators and decision-makers. Test traditional media, social media and disinformation analysis tools and advise on procurement and contracted services.

Stakeholder Management

Work closely with the IEA Unit, Audience Research Team and StratCom policy team within the section to integrate IEA into the communications planning process and coordinate seamlessly with other sections within PDD. Develop and maintain professional relationships across the civilian and military staff to promote synergies within and between different disciplines, including intelligence, cyber, operations, data policy, logistics, and information management. Work with Allies and partners, including the European External Acton Service and G7 Rapid Response Mechanism, to exchange expertise related to analysing information threats. Coordinate effectively with various stakeholders in order to get useful inputs with actionable recommendations for the delivery of regular IEA reports. Identify, strengthen and build relationships with partners, researchers and other experts to become better informed on IEA.

Project Management

Plan and deliver reports within tight deadlines on issues of relevance to PDD and senior NATO leadership. Demonstrate political acumen when selecting topics and analysing and assessing trends in the information environment. Work with other divisions at NATO to deliver briefings for senior NATO staff. Use initiative to recommend opportunities for Information Environment Assessment.

Perform any other related duty as assigned.


INTERRELATIONSHIPS



The incumbent carries out their duties under the overall direction of the Head, Information Environment Assessment Unit, and following day-to-day guidance of the Lead, Data Team . The incumbent maintains a close working relationship with other staff in the Unit, members of PDD, as well as counterparts in other Divisions, other NATO entities and in Allied Delegations and capitals.

Direct reports: N/a

Indirect reports: N/a.


COMPETENCIES



The incumbent must demonstrate:


Achievement: Works to meet standards.
Analytical Thinking: Sees multiple relationships.
Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work.
Conceptual Thinking: Applies learned concepts.
Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems.
Empathy: Is open to others’ perspectives.
Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade.
Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation.
Teamwork: Solicits inputs and encourages others



6. CONTRACT

Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years; possibility of renewal for up to three years, during which the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite duration contract.

Contract clause applicable:

In accordance with the contract policy, this is a post in which turnover is desirable for political reasons in order to be able to accommodate the Organisation's need to carry out its tasks as mandated by the Nations in a changing environment, for example by maintaining the flexibility necessary to shape the Organisation's skills profile, and to ensure appropriate international diversity.

The maximum period of service foreseen in this post is 6 years. The successful applicant will be offered a 3-year definite duration contract, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years. However, according to the procedure described in the contract policy the incumbent may apply for conversion to an indefinite contract during the period of renewal and no later than one year before the end of contract.

If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject also to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.

Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.


USEFUL INFORMATION REGARDING APPLICATION AND RECRUITMENT PROCESS



Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:

For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );

For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment

Before you apply to any position, we encourage you to click here and watch our video providing 6 tips to prepare you for your application and recruitment process.

Do you have questions on the application process in the system and not sure how to proceed? Click here for a video containing the information you need to successfully submit your application on time.

More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm)

Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate), approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser, verification of your study(ies) and work experience, and the successful completion of the accreditation and notification process by the relevant authorities.

NATO will not accept any phase of the recruitment and selection prepared, in whole or in part, by means of generative artificial-intelligence (AI) tools, including and without limitation to chatbots, such as Chat Generative Pre-trained Transformer (Chat GPT), or other language generating tools. NATO reserves the right to screen applications to identify the use of such tools. All applications prepared, in whole or in part, by means of such generative or creative AI applications may be rejected without further consideration at NATO’s sole discretion, and NATO reserves the right to take further steps in such cases as appropriate.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION



NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply. NATO is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible working environment, where all candidates living with disabilities can fully participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require reasonable accommodation, please inform us during your selection process. Candidates will be required to provide documented medical evidence to support their request for accommodation. Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work. Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with. Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements. The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours. The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements. Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment. For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab. NATO does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. For more info please click here .

  • SUMMARY


NATO’s Public Diplomacy efforts serve a vital function within the Alliance by communicating its purpose and priorities to audiences worldwide. In fulfilling this role, the Public Diplomacy Division (PDD) actively strengthens NATO’s public image, thereby fostering trust in and support for the Alliance. The Division also acts as coordinator for strategic communication activities across all NATO civilian and military bodies and commands.

The Data Insights and Information Threats section sits within PDD. It comprises the Information Environment Assessment (IEA) Unit, Audience Research Team, and a team managing strategic communications policy and NATO’s work on countering information threats. The Information Environment Assessment Unit, comprised of an Analysis and a Data Team, is the engine that provides data and evidence-based analysis of, and insights into, the information environment. The Unit develops action-orientated reporting and alerting to help NATO improve its Strategic Communications, as well as engagement with relevant stakeholders internally and externally.

The incumbent carries out the duties of IEA Data Analyst in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. They are responsible for applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of multiple publicly and commercially available data sources and services. Additionally, the incumbent produces analytical products with actionable recommendations, supporting data-driven decision making and helping to ensure a strategic approach to PDD’s multifaceted communications. They also help to shape the acquisition and adoption of cutting-edge analytical tools to help NATO’s IEA capability evolve.

  • QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE


Essential

The incumbent must:

  • possess a university degree, from an institute of a recognized standing, in a field relevant for the role (preferably such as data science or international relations);
  • have 2 years of professional experience in data analytics, and qualitative and quantitative research methods;
  • possess proven experience applying data analytics to the collection and analysis of traditional and social media;
  • possess proven experience in developing reporting products for senior and/or executive audiences;
  • be able to explain data as a convincing story;
  • have excellent communication, drafting and oral presentation skills;
  • demonstrate sound political judgment;
  • have strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact within a multicultural team and with diverse stakeholders across the Organization;
  • possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one; I (“Beginner”) in the other.


DESIRABLE

The following would be considered an advantage:

  • experience with quantitative methods and their application to trend analysis;
  • experience with natural language processing;
  • basic knowledge of programming languages, such as Python;
  • geographic expertise (Russia, China or/and Middle East North Africa);

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Drive Sustainability with Data (Immediate Consideration)




📍 Remote | Work from Anywhere (UK Time Zone)

💰 Salary: £40,000 - £55,000 (Up to £70,000 for Lead Role)

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available

📈 Career Growth – Opportunities for Progression in a High-Impact Industry

🌍 Make a Difference – Use Data to Tackle Climate Challenges




Are you passionate about using data to solve real-world problems? Do you want to contribute to a greener future while working in a fast-paced, forward-thinking environment? We’re a mission-driven sustainability company using technology and data to create a cleaner, more sustainable world. Now, we’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help shape the future of sustainability.




What You’ll Do

Analyse large and complex datasets to identify trends in carbon emissions, renewable energy, waste reduction, and sustainability initiatives.
Develop insightful dashboards and reports to help businesses and policymakers make data-driven environmental decisions.
Work closely with sustainability experts, engineers, and product teams to turn data into actionable insights.
Design and refine predictive models to assess environmental impact and forecast sustainability outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy, quality, and integrity, helping build reliable climate impact metrics.
Stay up to date with industry trends and contribute ideas to improve sustainability strategies.




What We’re Looking For

Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Python, R, or similar tools.
Proficiency in data visualisation platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Understanding of statistical methods and predictive modelling.
Passion for sustainability and an interest in climate data, energy systems, or ESG reporting.
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Previous experience in data analysis, sustainability, or a related field (preferred but not required).




Why Join?

🌍 Mission-Driven Work – Contribute to real, measurable environmental change.

💼 100% Remote & Flexible – Work from anywhere while following UK time zones.

📈 Career Growth – Be part of a company at the cutting edge of sustainable innovation.

🎓 Learning & Development – Access training, certifications, and mentorship opportunities.

🛂 Visa Sponsorship Available – We welcome global talent to drive our mission forward.

🏝 Generous Holiday Allowance – Enjoy a proper work-life balance with up to 38 days of paid leave.

❤️ Wellness & Mental Health Support – We prioritise your well-being.




This isn’t just another data role—it’s a chance to make a real impact in the fight against climate change. If you're passionate about sustainability and thrive in a data-driven environment, we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now – Let’s build a greener future together! 🌱

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Performance Data Analyst

Location: Brussels (50% on-site, 50% remote)

Duration: End of 2025

Start: ASAP

Languages: English + French OR Dutch




Role Overview:

Join the Measurement & Performance team within Marketing & Communication to analyze and visualize campaign performance, optimize strategies, and drive data-driven decision-making. You will work closely with the Campaign Manager, Product Owners, and Cluster Leads in this new department, requiring strong communication skills to translate data insights into actionable strategies.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop dashboards and reports to track marketing performance, campaign effectiveness, and customer behavior.
Analyze KPIs and campaign data to provide insights and recommend optimizations.
Ensure accurate data monitoring, integration, and visualization for data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with stakeholders to refine campaign strategies and business objectives.
Train users on reporting tools and foster a data-driven culture within the team.




Required Skills & Experience:

5+ years in data analysis, reporting, and visualization, with a focus on marketing, campaign performance, or business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and KPI tracking.
Experience in Marketing, Campaign, or Performance Analysis.
Excellent communication skills to work closely with the Campaign Manager, Product Owners, and Cluster Leads.
Experience in reporting and dashboard development.
Ideally experienced in SAS, Adobe Analytics, and Adobe Campaign.
Analytical mindset, ability to work under pressure, and strong business acumen.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're a global IT consulting company and a software development service provider that helps organizations operate at their best. With 30+ years of experience, +6 Global locations, and +1000 employees, TEAM combines technology expertise, valuable insights, business intelligence, and a client-centered approach to address challenges in business operations, digital transformation, risk management, compliance, business continuity, and more.




Description:

Team International is looking for Data analysts to join the FinCrime team working remotely from the EU.




Requirements:

The ability to start immediately or with a short notice
At least a bachelor's degree in data analysis or a similar field
At least 1,5 years of experience in Data Analysis
Understanding of basic and intermediate statistics
Experience with processing financial transactions
SQL, Python and Git
Outstanding English both verbal and written
Experience in the field of anti-financial crime or banking is a plus




Benefits

Being a part of TEAM International gives you the chance to work on challenging projects with great professionals, international clients, and the latest technologies.




We have a great benefits package that includes:

PTO days
Floating holidays
Sport allowance
Private Health Insurance compensation etc.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the company:

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.




To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.




About the role

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.




What you’ll do

Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
Document data processes and support data-related queries.




What you’ll need

Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python.
Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
Hands-on mentality and proactive mindset.




Why you should apply

Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
💼Job Title: Data Scientist

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

💼Work regime: Hybrid

🌐Language: English: Fluent spoken and written Dutch: Fluent/Good level OR French: Fluent/Good level

🔥Keywords: Predictive Analytics, AI Models, Data Science, Python, Marketing Campaigns

Sector:

Our client is a is a prominent telecommunications company known for its extensive network infrastructure and comprehensive range of services. It provides innovative solutions in internet, mobile, and television communications, catering to both residential and business customers.

Role Overview:

Mission Context:




The Predictive Analytics team within the Marketing and Communication department aims to provide predictive AI models to enable impactful and efficient campaigns by optimizing reach and relevance for customers and augmenting employees in the campaigning process.

Function Description:

We are looking for a medior/senior data scientist with a proven track record in building and deploying data science models to support marketing campaigns. You will be part of a data science team and will work on the following:
Tackle various business challenges by creating AI models to enhance client experiences, empower employees, and optimize internal processes.
Utilize a range of analytical methodologies within predictive AI, including large language models, classical statistical/machine learning techniques, and uplift modeling.
Capture business needs, perform data analyses, build models, and identify relevant target groups to achieve business objectives. Set up tests to measure model impact.
Inform, advise, and support Marketing & Communications Managers on the use of predictive models.
Present complex technical concepts as clear, actionable insights for Marketing & Communication Managers.
Follow up on production runs from data preparation, scoring, and validation of AI models. Maintain and monitor model performance to detect quality issues.
Support the creation of new variables (data engineering) and continuous improvement cycles of models.
Demonstrate extensive experience in programming with Python and contribute to deploying AI models in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
Apply guidelines and best practices for responsible AI.
Collaborate with a team of motivated data scientists eager to learn, share expertise, and work together.




Education:

At least a Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, mathematics, or computer science. Candidates with other academic backgrounds with substantial experience in data science are also encouraged to apply.

Required Experience/Knowledge:

At least 3 years of relevant experience.

Technical Experience:

Mandatory: Strong expertise in Python and Python data science environment (e.g., deep learning), Git, bash, SQL.

Preferable: Experience with Domino Data Science Platform, SAS, recommender systems, language models, optimization under constraints, Django.

Business Experience:

Preferable: Experience in campaigning, direct marketing, A/B testing.










A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Business Analyst (Power BI)
Description:
About the Job

Joining Capgemini Engineering means becoming part of a global organization that drives innovation and growth. With over 55 years of experience, a presence in 30 countries, and more than 55 000 employees, we offer an environment where you can elevate your career to new heights.

And that’s not all! As a Business Analyst (Power BI), you will play a key role for the Business planning process and product management activities for several accessories (for example winter complete wheels, styling accessories, multimedia accessories, transport accessories, safety and comfort accessories) for vehicle models. Together with your team, you will work on exciting projects in the automotive industry!

Capgemini Engineering: Get The Future You Want

Your Responsibilities

In this role, you will be responsible for:

Collaborating with diverse teams to identify, clarify, document and communicate business requirements according to client’s business needs.
Actively contributing to the success of projects by doing Market analysis/Competitor analysis/Sales analysis.
Building strong, sustainable relationships to coordinate and communicate with stakeholders to translate their needs into business requirements.
Business case and financial analysis.
Project management – Stakeholder management.
Data analysis.




Your Profile

At Capgemini Engineering, we’re looking for someone who:

Has a passion for Data and business intelligence project.
Brings at least 1 year of experience in Business intelligence tools (Power BI, …).
Knowledge of project management tools (Jira, MS Project…).
Language Skills: Fluent in English. French and/or Dutch is a plus.
Master’s degree Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, Business Administration, Business Management, Suppy Chain or equivalent.




Success in this role often comes down to:

Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.

Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.

Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.

Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.




What We Offer

At Capgemini Engineering, we offer more than just a job:

A full-time position with attractive secondary benefits.
A competitive salary package, including a company car, laptop, meal vouchers, bonus system, and more.
Training and development: Access to courses and certifications to enhance your skills.
Flexibility: A hybrid work model that supports work-life balance.
Regular company outings and events to celebrate success together.




Recruitment Process

Our recruitment process includes the following steps:

A first screening via phone
An initial interview with a Talent Acquisition Professional.
A discussion with one of our People Managers to ensure the right fit.
A meeting with our Technical Colleagues to assess your skills and experience.




Ready for the next step? Apply now and explore how your future could look at Capgemini Engineering!

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.

A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:


In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.


Meet the team:

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso’s direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.

What will make you successful:


Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.


Benefits:


A full-time position located in Brussels.
Hybrid working (2-3 days / week homeworking).
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place


Any questions?

Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.

Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?

Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

Please note

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages; if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

#Nespresso

Title: Data Analyst - Quality Expert
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.




You get even more bonus points if …




You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Show more

  • Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER


  • Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
  • We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
  • Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …


Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Associate Data Analyst (Brussels)
Description:
Company: POLITICO

Politico is looking for an Associate Data Analyst to join the Data Analytics team based in our Brussels office. The team is responsible for understanding and delivering reporting, analyses and other data capabilities that will enable Politico to achieve its strategic goals. This role will support all of Politico’s business operations, including newsletters, websites, paid-for services and more.

What You’ll Do


Support Politico’s commercial operations across European and US markets
Gather requirements from business, technical and editorial stakeholders
Discover, clean and organize data into usable datasets
Produce analyses, build reporting and present to stakeholders
Generate visualizations and dashboards that aid business decision-making
Develop materials to explain project findings
Work with the wider team in Brussels and Washington DC to develop skills and knowledge


What You'll Need

The following requirements describe an ideal candidate, so we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every single item:


Passionate about Politico’s mission to deliver nonpartisan journalism on politics and policy
Proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in Python
Experience with BI tools a plus
Familiarity with modern data warehouses (Snowflake) and cloud platforms (AWS)
Knowledge of Git
Knowledge of ETL fundamentals


Skills & Competencies


Ability to translate business requests into workable analytical tasks
Ability to creatively draw upon available resources to respond to business questions and anticipate potential challenges and how to overcome them
Ability to work with data to produce useful and insightful analysis
Ability to communicate complex analysis to a non-technical audience
Ability to work collaboratively and learn from the wider team


About POLITICO

POLITICO is a global news and information company at the intersection of politics and policy. It is the essential online, mobile and print destination for the most influential people in the world. With publications based in Washington, D.C., New York, London, and Brussels, POLITICO boasts an enormous roster of the most talented reporters and editors in the world.

Equal Opportunity

It is POLITICO's policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age or any other characteristic protected by local laws and regulations.

Application Instructions

If you are interested in this opportunity, please send a cover letter and CV in English using the Apply button. Please note that we will only consider complete applications.

Location: Brussels

Employment level: Full-time

Type of role: Specialists

Updated: March 19, 2025

Job ID: 00625

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Onze kant hecht veel belang aan een heldere communicatie naar haar klanten.

Als Beheerder Klantselectie zorg jij er mee voor dat die in de juiste brievenbussen belandt. Je ondersteunt de marketingafdeling met jouw analytische skills.




We zijn op zoek naar een kandidaat die kan opstarten op 01/04/2025 en beschikbaar is tot (minstens) 30/09/2025.




Jouw takenpakket als Beheerder Klantselectie:

Je kernactiviteit is doelgroepselectie op basis van klantendata, zodat onze marketingcampagnes gericht en effectief zijn.
Concreet zoek je uit in welke brievenbussen de communicaties terecht moeten komen. Je duikt daarvoor in onze klantendatabase en bepaalt de regio.
Je werkt hiervoor nauw samen met de Marketingafdeling die jou laat weten welke info ze net nodig hebben.
Je onderzoekt de kost van de bus-aan-busbedeling en koppelt terug naar de klant. Na goedkeuring zorg je voor de effectieve bestelling.
Je staat in voor het betalen van gemeentelijke taksen.
Wanneer er productrecalls binnen komen, ga je na welke klanten dit product hebben aangekocht zodat ze zo snel mogelijk kunnen geïnformeerd worden.




Wat verwachten we van jou:

Je hebt reeds administratieve ervaring en leert snel werken met nieuwe computerprogramma’s.
Je bent graag bezig met het analyseren van data, logische verbanden leggen en de juiste conclusies trekken.
Kennis van Excel en SAP is een pluspunt.
Communicatief - Je kan jouw ideeën, suggesties en gedachten helder overbrengen aan collega's, klanten en partners.
Analytisch vermogen - Je bent analytisch en kan verschillende informatie en data verwerken op korte tijd, zonder het overzicht te verliezen.
Strategisch denken - Je bent sterk in conceptueel denken en kan vlot verbanden leggen.
Stressbestendig - Je kan goed presteren onder druk, bent gewend om krappe deadlines te halen en tegelijkertijd veel ballen in de lucht te houden. Zelf in de meest stressvolle situaties blijf je kalm.
Talenkennis - Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands.




What's in it for you?:

Je werkt in Halle en kan tot 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in een van de regionale kantoren van onze klant.
Je geniet een mooie verloning, aangevuld met extralegale voordelen zoals: mobiliteitsbudget (openbaar vervoer of auto zijn mogelijk), maaltijdcheques, eco-cheques, groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, thuiswerkvergoeding, internetvergoeding en meer...
Als Harvey Nash Consultant kan je rekenen op begeleiding en ontwikkeling in je loopbaan. Zo matchen we jou met opportuniteiten op maat van jouw interesse en kennis en voorzien we een jaarlijks opleidingsbudget om jouw skills te verscherpen.

Show more

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

The responsibility of the Insights Analyst is to analyze in store customer behavior to address customer questions and provide KPIs to customers. They will also address custom questions from customers using video analysis and python to model customer behavior and provide aggregated insights into customer behavior and performance of various areas in store. They will work closely with the AA Lead to ensure solutions and projects are ready to be delivered to customers.

Responsibilities:


Data Expertise
Have a strong ability to visualize how our data represents shoppers moving through spaces, and to use the best methodology to draw out the right answer, or develop new methodologies as needed
Identifying and surfacing challenges in the data or timelines to the Analytics Lead and providing thoughtful solutions
Project Work
Be a technical counterpart to REM team, translating pre-defined project specifications into accurate, clear and properly formatted outputs within established timelines
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to surface any potential challenges with data, project scope or timelines
Attend meetings with the Retail Engagement Manager teams as needed to understand their needs and explain results, methodologies etc.

Skills:


Ability to be a data expert and successfully create and use best methodologies to solve customer questions or requests


Knowledge:


Understanding of Python in order to best address specific customer needs
Understanding of the RetailNext product to better answer customer questions as needed


Talents:


Ability to problem solve through customer issues and requests using RetailNext data


What's It Like to Work Here?


Remote-First Hybrid: Work anywhere + office access.
90-Day Work Anywhere: Work from anywhere for 90 days yearly.
Autonomy & Growth: Flexible schedules, ownership, career investment.
Customer Obsessed: Everything we do is for our clients.


Perks & Benefits


Best Self Allowance: Annual stipend for personal growth.
Recharge Days: Monthly company-wide day off.
Career Growth: We invest in you.


Join us and transform retail with data-driven insights! Apply now

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French

Title: Fully Remote: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote - anywhere in Belgium




Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification Path:

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements:

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Dutch language
Being a resident of Belgium for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in the Belgium
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion,, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Show more

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Function

Advisory - Advisor

Roles & Responsibilities

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

Role Overview

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications


Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English


We offer


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Vacature omschrijving

Om ons datateam te versterken zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven data analyst die een cruciale rol zal spelen in het interpreteren en gebruiken van commerciële en financiële gegevens om inzichten te bieden aan het managementteam.

Jouw Verantwoordelijkheden Omvatten Onder Meer


Opstellen en opvolgen van dashboards om de commerciële prestaties van de organisatie te monitoren, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
Maken van analyses en deep dives zowel proactief als op vraag. Op basis van de noden vanuit de business analyseer je de beschikbare informatie en vertaal je die in adviezen voor het managementteam.
Analyseren van verkoopgegevens, markttrends en klantgedrag om inzicht te krijgen in de prestaties van het assortiment en te komen tot een perfecte productmix.
Identificeren van kansen voor productuitbreiding en vernieuwing op basis van marktanalyse en klantbehoeften
Monitoren van voorraadniveaus en het optimaliseren van de voorraadrotatie.


Profiel


Bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische en/of economische richting. Ook pas afgestudeerden zijn welkom.
Uitstekende kennis van Excel voor analyse en presentatie van gegevens.
Ervaring met opstellen van commerciële dashboards en rapporten is een extra troef.
Ervaring met SAP of vergelijkbare ERP-systemen is een pluspunt.
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en probleemoplossend vermogen.
Hands-on mentaliteit om het terrein te verkennen en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.


Wij bieden


Teamsfeer – Reken op fijne collega’s die je steunen en met wie je samen plezier maakt.
Opleiding – Je wordt opgeleid in je job en daarnaast hebben we een aanbod van opleidingen voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met tal van extralegale voordelen zoals maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, extra verlofdagen en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk.


Waarom werken bij DreamLand?

Bij DreamLand kan je anders werken. Jij staat als mens centraal en dat merk je meteen. Zo kan je je vaardigheden scherpstellen dankzij onze ontwikkelingsgerichte aanpak en intern doorgroeien als je dat wilt. Of je nu analist, winkelmedewerker, marketeer of logistiek medewerker bent, bij ons vind je vast een job die perfect bij je past.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client’s request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting… could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst/ Data Migration Specialist (S/4HANA)

Location: Europe (Remote)

Duration: Contract upto 12 months on B2B




Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Migration Specialist to join our team and play a critical role in our SAP ECC to S/4HANA migration project. He will collaborate with cross-functional teams, SNP, including functional consultants, technical developers, and business stakeholders, to deliver a successful migration.




Responsibilities:

Data Migration Planning and Strategy:
Participate in the development of the overall data migration strategy and plan.
Work with Onsite Data Leads from Viatris and explain them what changes and not changes in S4 vs ECC>
Work closely with SNP to ensure Data Loads happen successfully
Understanding the process pf data validation and reconciliation to ensure data accuracy and completeness.
Troubleshoot and resolve data migration issues along with SNP.
Collaborate with business users to ensure data accuracy and completeness.
Work closely with functional consultants, technical developers, and business stakeholders to ensure successful data migration.
Provide regular updates on data migration progress and issues.
Communicate effectively with all stakeholders to ensure alignment and understanding.
Document all data migration activities and procedures.
Participate in cutover planning and execution.
Provide post-migration support to address data-related issues.
Monitor data quality and performance after migration.

Experience:

Minimum of 6-10 years of experience in SAP data migration projects.
Proven experience in SAP ECC to S/4HANA data migration.
Strong understanding of SAP data structures and business processes.
Working with SNP in previous projects is an added advantage.
Experience with specific industry solutions – Pharma.

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
A propos de JEMS

Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…

Vos missions

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Analyst confirmé(e) capable d'accompagner les métiers dans l'aide à la décision.

Vous Aurez La Charge De


Guider / recommander le Métier dans l’exploitation et la valorisation des multiples sources de données et identifier des leviers d’optimisation et d’amélioration des processus Business
Être l‘intermédiaire entre le Métier et la DSI
Accroître la connaissance de la clientèle d’une entreprise, conduire des études sur les bases de données, suivre les outils datamining pour analyser l’impact des actions marketing
Mener et conduire des études (coordination/pilotage)


Vos compétences

En Tant Que Data Analyst Vous Maitrisez


MS Office
Le requêtage SQL
Des outils BI Fonction Expertise sur les données du Métier
Des solutions Analytiques (Data Science ou Data Mining / BI)
Des outils de datavisualisation
La préparation de données


Votre profil

Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur ou d’un parcours universitaire technique. Vous justifiez d’au minimum 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Analyst.

Avantages à travailler chez JEMS


Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)
Une entreprise reconnue "Great Place To Work"
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales


Mobilité

Une mobilité nationale et internationale pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de vie.

Diversité

Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur "Diversité" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
