Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist (Consultancy – Opdracht bij klant)




Over het project

Voor een klant in Brussel zoeken we een ervaren Data Analist die bijdraagt aan het analyseren en optimaliseren van datastromen. Je werkt binnen een consultancy-context, waarbij je 1 à 2 dagen per week onsite aanwezig bent bij de klant.




Jouw rol als Data Analist

Als Data Analist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren, structureren en vertalen van complexe datastromen naar bruikbare inzichten. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende stakeholders binnen de organisatie en draagt bij aan de verdere optimalisatie van data-analyses en rapporteringstools.




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert dashboards en rapporten.
Je fungeert als aanspreekpunt voor de business binnen een functioneel domein en zorgt voor een duidelijke communicatie met stakeholders.
Je coördineert werkzaamheden binnen een team van ongeveer vijf personen en zorgt ervoor dat de functionele en technische scope correct wordt geïmplementeerd binnen de Agile sprintwerking.
Je blijft op de hoogte van trends en evoluties binnen data-analyse en past deze kennis toe in de praktijk.
Je stelt kritische vragen en past je communicatiestijl aan op basis van je gesprekspartner.
Je vertaalt business requirements naar concrete data-oplossingen met behulp van interviewtechnieken.
Je gebruikt SQL om zelfstandig queries op te stellen en datastromen te analyseren.




Jouw profiel

We zoeken een data-analist met een analytische mindset en sterke communicatieve vaardigheden. Jij herkent jezelf in de volgende punten:




Essentiële vaardigheden en ervaring:

Ervaring met data-analyse-oplossingen, inclusief zowel traditionele ETL-datawarehouses als moderne, event-gedreven architecturen.
Goede kennis van data-modellen zoals 3e normale vorm, Data Vault en dimensionele modellen.
Ervaring met Agile-methodologieën en Scrum (E2E Agility, Business Value, backlogbeheer, refinement, story slicing, etc.).
Praktische ervaring met tools zoals Jira en Confluence.
Hands-on ervaring met SQL voor data-analyse en testdata-extractie.
Kennis van de sector en relevante marktinzichten is een belangrijke troef.




Gewenste kennis en vaardigheden:

Kennis van en ervaring met datavirtualisatie en event-driven architecturen (Kafka, Apache NiFi).
Ervaring met het lezen en begrijpen van Python- en SAS-code.
Kennis van BI-tools zoals MicroStrategy en OBI, inclusief de mogelijkheden en beperkingen.
Ervaring met het definiëren en bouwen van dashboards en rapportages.
Begrip van unstructured data en grote datavolumes, inclusief technieken om hiermee om te gaan.
Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een Scrum-framework is een pluspunt.
Kennis van ETL-tools zoals ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.




Locatie & werkomgeving

Opdracht bij de klant in Brussel.
1 à 2 dagen per week onsite.
Consultancy-opdracht.




Taalvereisten

Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en kunt je goed uitdrukken in het Engels.




Ben jij de data-analist die we zoeken? Solliciteer dan nu en word onderdeel van een dynamisch team dat bijdraagt aan de digitale transformatie!

Show more

  • Ervaring met Agile-methodologieën en Scrum (E2E Agility, Business Value, backlogbeheer, refinement, story slicing, etc.).
  • Praktische ervaring met tools zoals Jira en Confluence.
  • Hands-on ervaring met SQL voor data-analyse en testdata-extractie.
  • Kennis van de sector en relevante marktinzichten is een belangrijke troef.


Gewenste kennis en vaardigheden:

  • Kennis van en ervaring met datavirtualisatie en event-driven architecturen (Kafka, Apache NiFi).
  • Ervaring met het lezen en begrijpen van Python- en SAS-code.
  • Kennis van BI-tools zoals MicroStrategy en OBI, inclusief de mogelijkheden en beperkingen.
  • Ervaring met het definiëren en bouwen van dashboards en rapportages.
  • Begrip van unstructured data en grote datavolumes, inclusief technieken om hiermee om te gaan.
  • Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een Scrum-framework is een pluspunt.
  • Kennis van ETL-tools zoals ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.


Locatie & werkomgeving

  • Opdracht bij de klant in Brussel.
  • 1 à 2 dagen per week onsite.
  • Consultancy-opdracht.


Taalvereisten

  • Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en kunt je goed uitdrukken in het Engels.


Ben jij de data-analist die we zoeken? Solliciteer dan nu en word onderdeel van een dynamisch team dat bijdraagt aan de digitale transformatie!

Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst -  September 2025
Description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.



Your profile

We Are Looking For Someone Who


Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Is eligible for security clearance.



Success In This Role Often Comes Down To


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.



Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.



Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Junior Clinical Data Analyst (BE)
Description:
CluePoints is an innovative, fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Monitoring and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products enable both risk planning and operational risk monitoring, and utilize advanced statistical algorithms to determine the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. CluePoints is seeking outstanding candidates with strong data analytics aptitude and a passion for delivery excellence, to help drive customer success and broad adoption of the CluePoints solution.

Responsibilities


Perform the technical configuration of the CluePoints solution for clinical studies based on customer requirements
Perform analyses using the CluePoints Central Monitoring Platform – diagnosing and explaining anomalies identified in the clinical study data
Summarize findings and support the communication of results to customers (both written report and oral presentation)
Participate in the continuous improvement and development of our product solutions and operational processes
Provide consultation and related operational support to customers as needed, with the help of more senior Data Analysts and/or the CluePoints Project Lead
Ensure that appropriate documentation is produced and maintained for each study
Assist Business Development and Quality Assurance teams in responding to client questions and requests (e.g., RFP responses, audits, etc.)


Skills Needed


Experience with one or more programming languages (preferably SAS)
At least one first experience in clinical trials (data management or CRA)
Aptitude for mathematical and statistical concepts
Excellent English oral and written communication skills
Experience and ability to work well in a team environment
Ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment, under time and resource constraints
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Experience with CDISC databases is a plus


Qualifications Needed


College degree, preferably in a scientific or technical discipline
0-2 years of experience in a clinical research environment.


Top Reasons to Work with Us

Flexibility is part of our DNA


Hybrid role (2-3 days per week at the office)
Our offices provide a fun atmosphere: PS4, foosball, and our newly added dartboard
Many activities are organized during the year such as team lunches, happy hours, team buildings, holiday parties and many other celebrations!
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards.
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits !


How To Apply

Please simply click the button on this page!

The role is based in our offices in Belgium. We will strictly only consider applications from candidates that are residents and/or hold a valid work permit for the location they apply for.

Title: Junior Research Analyst
HTML:
MMGY Global is the largest and most integrated travel marketing firm in the world specialising in travel, tourism, hospitality, culinary experiences, and entertainment. To ensure we invest our clients’ budgets in ways that maximise their success, we work hard to provide the best innovative proprietary research across all destination marketing and management channels and disciplines. The MMGY Travel Intelligence division is vital to creating and sustaining the company’s sustainable competitive advantage in the travel and tourism industry.


The Junior Research Analyst role will be based in Brussels and report to a Senior Analyst. This position will also have the opportunity to work with other team members of the Travel Intelligence Group based in other locations (France, UK, US). MMGY Travel Intelligence in Brussels (TCI Research) focuses on destination intelligence and works for the most prestigious tourism destinations and travel brands in and outside Europe, using a combination of surveys and big data.



Duties and Responsibilities of the Junior Research Analyst:



  • Will serve as an analyst for all research projects within their assigned portfolio, including data analytics, critical thinking, and the translation of data into true insights. The Junior Research Analyst will also work closely with MMGY channel leaders to help translate insights into strategic solutions, ideas and recommendations;
  • Will serve as the primary member for collecting, processing and controlling data, using in-house data solutions, including surveys and big data sources.
  • Will work closely with other data operations teams on project methodology design, data collection strategies, data tabulation quality control, and report design;
  • Will be responsible for survey design, development, and the structure, layout, and content of client reports and deliverables using agency report templates and design standards;
  • Will be responsible for the data visualisation in reports and dashboards.
  • Will provide excellent client service under a Key Account Manager’s supervision when it comes to the day-to-day communication within projects.
  • Will collaborate on a cross-functional basis with other MMGY teams, including tasks such as improving strategies for data collection, quality and analysis.



About you:



At MMGY Global we believe that in order to go places as a company, we must give others the opportunity to shine. We strive to create a vibrant, open, and collaborative work environment where people can be and bring their best selves to work. We are looking for an ambitious candidate with relevant experience in a similar role, or somebody looking for the next step in their career. The requirements for the role are:



  • A first relevant experience in market research, data analysis and reporting, trend-based tracking and analysis, or similar;
  • Experience in statistical modelling, data analytics, and data management tools, including SPSS or similar, BI solutions (Tableau, Power BI..) and Microsoft Excel, strongly preferred;
  • Experience in the creation, scripting, fielding, and analysis of questionnaires and survey data;
  • Must be comfortable working autonomously – albeit within a defined structure and with appropriate support – and possess excellent attention to detail;
  • Fast learner and interest in new modes of data and BI technology (social listening, dataviz, dashboards...)
  • Must be proactive, innovation-driven, self-motivated, adept at dealing with ambiguity, possess strong time management skills, and have excellent written and oral communication skills;
  • Must have strong computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Interest in the travel and/or tourism industries is a must, and experience in them is a plus;
  • English is your native working language, and knowledge of other languages is a plus.



Benefits of working at MMGY Travel Intelligence:

  • A permanent contract within an attractive working environment in an international, culturally diverse, professional and motivated team.
  • A role with challenging assignments and responsibilities that holds real growth opportunities.
  • An attractive base salary in relation to your degree and competencies, as well as extra-legal benefits.
  • A good work-life balance.
  • A flexible hybrid working schedule.

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance
Description:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST - INSURANCE SECTOR

Your Role & Work Environment

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in fostering a data-driven culture within a leading company in the insurance sector. Your mission will be to support business teams by providing valuable insights that enhance decision-making processes and optimize customer interactions.

You will be part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, collaborating with professionals across various domains to develop impactful analytical solutions. Your work will focus on creating automated dashboards, conducting deep dives into customer behaviors, and generating advanced reports to drive strategic initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Translating Business Needs into Analytical Solutions


Engage with stakeholders to understand and challenge business requirements.
Assess feasibility, define clear objectives, and set realistic timelines.
Ensure data availability and design a suitable analytical approach, effectively communicating your methodology to stakeholders.


Data Analysis & Execution


Conduct in-depth analysis on customer data to address business questions.
Perform customer behavior analysis and develop predictive models.
Create advanced ad-hoc reports using tools such as SQL, Cognos, and Adobe Analytics.


Delivering Insights & Recommendations


Use data visualization techniques to communicate findings effectively.
Adapt messaging and storytelling to suit different audiences.
Provide clear, data-driven recommendations while considering data privacy regulations.


What We Are Looking For

We seek a proactive, analytical, and results-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. You should have a strong ability to translate business needs into actionable data insights while maintaining a critical and strategic mindset.

Required Qualifications & Skills


Master's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analytics, with at least 2 years in the insurance sector.
Strong SQL skills (mandatory).
Experience with analytical tools such as SAS, Cognos, or Adobe Analytics (preferred).
Ability to influence stakeholders through data-driven insights.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong analytical mindset.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).


What We Offer


A dynamic, fast-paced environment where innovation and collaboration drive success.
Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development in data analytics.
A work culture that values ownership, creativity, and analytical excellence.
The chance to work on strategic projects with high business impact.


If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and have experience in the insurance sector, we would love to hear from you!

Apply Now
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Als Beheerder Klantselectie ben jij de schakel tussen de marketingafdeling en onze klanten. Jouw kernactiviteit is het selecteren van de juiste doelgroepen voor de marketingcampagnes, op basis van klantendata. Je zorgt ervoor dat de communicatie in de juiste brievenbussen terechtkomt, door de klantendatabase te analyseren en de juiste regio’s te bepalen.




Concreet houdt dit in:




Het selecteren van doelgroepen op basis van klantendata voor gerichte marketingcampagnes.
Samenwerken met de marketingafdeling om te bepalen welke informatie nodig is en hoe we deze het best kunnen verspreiden.
Het onderzoeken van de kosten van bus-aan-busbedelingen en het terugkoppelen van de prijs aan de klant.
Het afhandelen van gemeentelijke taksen en zorgen voor tijdige betalingen.
Het beheren van productrecalls door te onderzoeken welke klanten betrokken zijn en hen zo snel mogelijk te informeren.




Kennis en ervaring: Je hebt administratieve ervaring en leert snel nieuwe computerprogramma’s. Kennis van Excel en SAP is een plus.

Communicatief: Je kan ideeën, suggesties en gedachten duidelijk overbrengen aan collega’s, klanten en partners.

Analytisch vermogen: Je kunt grote hoeveelheden data verwerken en de juiste conclusies trekken.

Strategisch denken: Je hebt een goed conceptueel denkvermogen en legt vlot verbanden.

Stressbestendigheid: Je blijft kalm, zelfs onder druk, en weet krappe deadlines te halen.




Talenkennis: Je hebt een vlotte communicatie in het Nederlands.




What's in it for you?

Een projectcontract van 6 maand met allerhande extralegale voordelen (maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, bedrijfswagen optie, groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering)

Show more

Title: Data Analysis Intern for Powertrain Division
Description:
In a nutshell

Analyze driving and charging data from EVs and PHEVs to define future battery and system requirements. Use MATLAB, Python, and multiple data sources to track market trends and enhance vehicle performance.

Company Information

TOYOTA is one of the world’s largest automobile manufacturers and a leading global corporation. Founded in 1937. Toyota now sells vehicles in 170 countries and employs over 350.000 people. Based in Brussels, Belgium, and staffed by 2.700 people and more than 60 nationalities, Toyota Motor Europe (TME) handles the wholesale marketing of Toyota and Lexus vehicles, parts & accessories, and manages Toyota’s European R&D, manufacturing, and engineering operations.

We are excited to be transforming into a mobility company focusing on bringing even more happiness to our customers through various mobility solutions.

Team/division Description

Your team and your responsibilities

The Powertrain Division at Toyota Motor Europe is responsible for developing powertrains for vehicles produced in Europe and researching new automotive technologies. The team focuses on electrification, big data, and connectivity to shape the future of mobility.

Your project

You will analyze driving and charging data from Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicles (PHEV) and Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV) to define requirements for future high-voltage battery systems. Your insights will help monitor market trends and optimize vehicle specifications to exceed customer expectations.


Analyze quantitative & qualitative data from customer vehicles
Support definition future vehicle and battery specifications based on market trends
Use MATLAB and Python for data processing and visualization
Summarize and present complex technical information clearly


Your Profile


You are fluent in English (TME’s business language)
University student
You have a European EEA citizenship. (not requiring a visum to work in Belgium)
Open personality and able to work independently in a multi-cultural business environment.
Able to summarize and explain complex technical information in a clear and visual way.
Working proficiency in MATLAB (must), Python (must)


Starting date


May 2025


Duration


6 months


Confidentiality

Due to business requirement, not all performed projects can be reflected in the internship report. This issue needs to be discussed with candidate/school in advance.

It is mandatory that applicants are students for the entire period of the internship.

We can only accept students with an EEA or Swiss citizenship (not requiring a work permit or visa to be eligible to perform an internship in Belgium)

We offer

We offer a dynamic multicultural work environment with broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.

Your benefits


Flexible working hours and hybrid working (homeworking, 10 days from abroad);
Company restaurant – Warm dishes, salads and desserts daily, including Japanese and traditional Belgian specialties, as well as a vegan/vegetarian option;
Sport facilities – Tennis, squash, volleyball, football and softball pitches are available at various Toyota sites;
Team building activities and other personnel related events;
Programs to support your physical and social well-being.


A truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace

At Toyota Motor Europe, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all. All our recruitment decisions are based on the individual and their qualifications along with the job requirements. The selection process is without regard to nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, ethnicity, disability or other personal characteristics. We do not tolerate harassment or discrimination as our individual experiences and overall diversity is our key strength. Together we have the power to make a positive change and go beyond the ordinary.

If you need any specific consideration for the interview process due to disability or any other reason, please let the recruiter know.
Show more

It is mandatory that applicants are students for the entire period of the internship.

We can only accept students with an EEA or Swiss citizenship (not requiring a work permit or visa to be eligible to perform an internship in Belgium)

 We offer

We offer a dynamic multicultural work environment with broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.

Your benefits

  • Flexible working hours and hybrid working (homeworking, 10 days from abroad);
  • Company restaurant – Warm dishes, salads and desserts daily, including Japanese and traditional Belgian specialties, as well as a vegan/vegetarian option;
  • Sport facilities – Tennis, squash, volleyball, football and softball pitches are available at various Toyota sites;
  • Team building activities and other personnel related events;
  • Programs to support your physical and social well-being.

A truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace

At Toyota Motor Europe, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all. All our recruitment decisions are based on the individual and their qualifications along with the job requirements. The selection process is without regard to nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, ethnicity, disability or other personal characteristics. We do not tolerate harassment or discrimination as our individual experiences and overall diversity is our key strength. Together we have the power to make a positive change and go beyond the ordinary.

If you need any specific consideration for the interview process due to disability or any other reason, please let the recruiter know.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Data & Reporting Analyst, vous travaillez pour le département Performance & Ponctualité, qui cherche à améliorer l'expérience des passagers grâce à des analyses basés sur les données, en améliorant la ponctualité de nos trains, en réduisant le nombre de trains annulés et en augmentant le pourcentage de correspondances réussies.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

En tant Data & Reporting Analyst, vous êtes responsable de l'analyse des données opérationnelles et du développement de rapports et dashboards. Vous apportez un soutien basé sur les analyses des données à d'autres services et équipes au sein de la SNCB et contribuez à l'amélioration de la ponctualité et de l'efficacité opérationnelle de l'organisation.

Voici une liste de vos différentes responsabilités :


Vous concevez, développez et améliorez des outils pour le suivi et l'analyse des performances et des différents paramètres de qualité des services ferroviaires de la SNCB (ex. ponctualité, annulations, correspondances, compositions des trains).
Vous effectuez des analyses complexes basées sur les données existanteset vous rapportez les résultats au sein de l'entreprise.
Par exemple, vous analysez l'impact des changements opérationnels structurels sur la ponctualité des trains (ex : la mise en œuvre du système de contrôle des trains européen (ETCS)).
Vous intégrez et harmonisez les données provenant de différentes sources et les présentez dans des dashboards compréhensibles et utilisables.
Vous maintenez et optimisez les rapports existants dans Power BI.
Vous développez des rapports KPI qui contribuent à améliorer l’efficacité et la ponctualité de nos trains. Vous répondez aux besoins et aux demandes de l'entreprise.


Un job fait pour vous ?

Vous possédez un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) et vous avez au moins 2 ans d'expérience en analyse de données.

De plus, vous possédez les compétences suivantes :


Vous avez une bonne connaissance de SQL et/ou Python. En outre, la connaissance de l'écosystème Microsoft Azure (Datafactory, AAS, Databricks, PowerBi...) est un atout.
Vous avez un esprit analytique et êtes prêt à vous approprier la matière complexe des opérations de transport d'un opérateur ferroviaire.
Vous avez la capacité de traduire des données complexes en informations opérationnels utilisables.
Vous communiquez facilement et comprenez les besoins et attentes du business.
Vous êtes à l'aise en français et avez une bonne connaissance de base du néerlandais.


Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

Choisir la SNCB, c'est choisir un environnement où vous pouvez apprendre et vous épanouir. Vous serez entouré de chouettes collègues qui vous soutiendront. Nous vous offrons un package salarial qui se compose de :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13eme mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, une voiture en leasing, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Ce défi vous parle ? Postulez à la SNCB !

Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillerez au sein de l’équipe « Data & Performance Management » dans le bâtiment Atrium, à deux pas de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi.

What’s next ?


Vous postulez en ligne.
Nous lisons votre CV et votre lettre de motivation avec grande attention. Nous vous appelons éventuellement pour faire plus ample connaissance.
Vous passez un premier entretien d’embauche dans lequel vous pourrez montrer votre motivation et vos compétences. Pour préparer cet entretien, vous complétez un questionnaire de personnalité.
Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous commencez votre premier jour de travail !


Nous nous réservons la possibilité d'ajuster ou de suspendre cette procédure en cas de nécessité.

Notre équipe de recrutement sélectionnera les profils les plus en adéquation avec les exigences du poste afin de garantir une correspondance optimale.

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq 50570

Benjamin Patris

benjamin.patris@sncb.be

Sur le processus de sélection :

Zoë Mbeka

zoe.mbeka@sncb.be

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Intégrez une équipe innovante et dynamique dans le secteur de la mobilité, où vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le développement d'une application essentielle pour la région de Bruxelles. Nous recherchons un professionnel engagé prêt à transformer des données complexes en solutions pratiques.

En tant que Business Data Manager, vous êtes le lien entre les données et les décisions stratégiques. Si vous avez une expérience avérée dans l'analyse de données et en gestion de projets, nous serions ravis de vous compter parmi nous.

Vous collectez, analysez et interprétez les données générées par l'application Floya et ses outils connectés.
Vous collaborez étroitement avec l'équipe Floya pour orienter les décisions basées sur des analyses de performance.
Vous extrayez et nettoyez les données pour garantir leur qualité avant analyse.
Vous identifiez des indicateurs clés et développez des tableaux de bord personnalisés pour suivre les KPIs.
Vous présentez les conclusions de manière claire pour les parties prenantes non-expertes.
Vous gérez les relations avec les prestataires techniques et assurez l'intégration correcte des données.
Vous apportez des solutions pragmatiques aux défis rencontrés et soutenez les équipes dans leurs besoins métiers.

Requirements

Vous avez au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Business Data Manager ou Data Scientist.
Vous maîtrisez des outils comme Excel, Python, et Power BI pour l'analyse et la visualisation des données.
Vous avez une bonne compréhension des systèmes de gestion de bases de données tels que MySQL et le langage SQL.
Vous êtes un excellent communicateur.
Vous montrez une forte capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes.
Vous avez l'habitude de travailler en étroite collaboration avec diverses équipes.
Vous êtes capable de prendre des décisions basées sur des analyses stratégiques.
Vous êtes à l'aise avec la manipulation et le nettoyage des données pour garantir leur cohérence.
Vous êtes titulaire d'un Master en Data Science, Data Engineering ou IT.
Vous êtes fluide en anglais et avez une maîtrise native ou bilingue en français ou néerlandais.
Show more

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.

A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:


In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.


Meet the team:

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso’s direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.

What will make you successful:


Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.


Benefits:


A full-time position located in Brussels.
Hybrid working (2-3 days / week homeworking).
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place


Any questions?

Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.

Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?

Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

Please note

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages; if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

#Nespresso

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
LittleBigCode is a digital consulting laboratory specializing in Data and Artificial Intelligence. Our mission is to democratize the use of these technologies by co-building useful applications with our customers for the Society of the future, particularly on subjects related to health, mobility or the environment. For this, we deliver turnkey projects and also work on consulting assignments while developing our own solutions. Finally, we combine Cloud technologies, AGILE methods and DevOps culture to facilitate industrialization and scaling up.




Our big success so far:

A community of more than 50 enthusiasts of Data Science & Data Engineering domains
International presence & missions – we are launching our new office in Belgium!
Workshops, Innovation contests, customers challenges taken up




As such, we are looking to build our technical team in Belgium ! Join us !




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data and analysis. You will be working in the following areas:

Business case study with business teams, understanding of business requirements
Design of Data solutions
Analysis of customer data and processes in order to study their valuation
Elaboration of Data Analysis solutions
Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications
Creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights
Support your customers in the use of the applications you developed
Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations




Who are you ?




You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics…) and you have some experiences as a Data Analyst
You have bases in the realization of dashboards/reporting, the development of Data solutions models and applications starting from-scratch
You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills!
You are fully proficient in Python, SQL and DataViz tools
You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)
Note that we are also big devotees of DevOps so the more you are comfortable with it, all the better!
Fluent in English + in Dutch and/or French
Show more

Title: Junior Research Analyst
HTML:
MMGY Global is the largest and most integrated travel marketing firm in the world specialising in travel, tourism, hospitality, culinary experiences, and entertainment. To ensure we invest our clients’ budgets in ways that maximise their success, we work hard to provide the best innovative proprietary research across all destination marketing and management channels and disciplines. The MMGY Travel Intelligence division is vital to creating and sustaining the company’s sustainable competitive advantage in the travel and tourism industry.


The Junior Research Analyst role will be based in Brussels and report to a Senior Analyst. This position will also have the opportunity to work with other team members of the Travel Intelligence Group based in other locations (France, UK, US). MMGY Travel Intelligence in Brussels (TCI Research) focuses on destination intelligence and works for the most prestigious tourism destinations and travel brands in and outside Europe, using a combination of surveys and big data.



Duties and Responsibilities of the Junior Research Analyst:



  • Will serve as an analyst for all research projects within their assigned portfolio, including data analytics, critical thinking, and the translation of data into true insights. The Junior Research Analyst will also work closely with MMGY channel leaders to help translate insights into strategic solutions, ideas and recommendations;
  • Will serve as the primary member for collecting, processing and controlling data, using in-house data solutions, including surveys and big data sources.
  • Will work closely with other data operations teams on project methodology design, data collection strategies, data tabulation quality control, and report design;
  • Will be responsible for survey design, development, and the structure, layout, and content of client reports and deliverables using agency report templates and design standards;
  • Will be responsible for the data visualisation in reports and dashboards.
  • Will provide excellent client service under a Key Account Manager’s supervision when it comes to the day-to-day communication within projects.
  • Will collaborate on a cross-functional basis with other MMGY teams, including tasks such as improving strategies for data collection, quality and analysis.



About you:



At MMGY Global we believe that in order to go places as a company, we must give others the opportunity to shine. We strive to create a vibrant, open, and collaborative work environment where people can be and bring their best selves to work. We are looking for an ambitious candidate with relevant experience in a similar role, or somebody looking for the next step in their career. The requirements for the role are:



  • A first relevant experience in market research, data analysis and reporting, trend-based tracking and analysis, or similar;
  • Experience in statistical modelling, data analytics, and data management tools, including SPSS or similar, BI solutions (Tableau, Power BI..) and Microsoft Excel, strongly preferred;
  • Experience in the creation, scripting, fielding, and analysis of questionnaires and survey data;
  • Must be comfortable working autonomously – albeit within a defined structure and with appropriate support – and possess excellent attention to detail;
  • Fast learner and interest in new modes of data and BI technology (social listening, dataviz, dashboards...)
  • Must be proactive, innovation-driven, self-motivated, adept at dealing with ambiguity, possess strong time management skills, and have excellent written and oral communication skills;
  • Must have strong computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Interest in the travel and/or tourism industries is a must, and experience in them is a plus;
  • English is your native working language, and knowledge of other languages is a plus.



Benefits of working at MMGY Travel Intelligence:

  • A permanent contract within an attractive working environment in an international, culturally diverse, professional and motivated team.
  • A role with challenging assignments and responsibilities that holds real growth opportunities.
  • An attractive base salary in relation to your degree and competencies, as well as extra-legal benefits.
  • A good work-life balance.
  • A flexible hybrid working schedule.

Title: Fully Remote: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote - anywhere in Belgium




Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.




Qualification Path:

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements:

Full Professional Proficiency in English & Dutch language
Being a resident of Belgium for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in the Belgium
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion,, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst who thrives in the ever-changing world of Information Technology? Then we have exciting opportunities for you!




We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.




Your job responsibilities:




Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.
Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.




Your Requirements:




Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client’s needs.




You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.




Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We thrive for the absolute match, technically and personally, for both parties.




We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.




Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a “can do” attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!




Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

The responsibility of the Insights Analyst is to analyze in store customer behavior to address customer questions and provide KPIs to customers. They will also address custom questions from customers using video analysis and python to model customer behavior and provide aggregated insights into customer behavior and performance of various areas in store. They will work closely with the AA Lead to ensure solutions and projects are ready to be delivered to customers.

Responsibilities:


Data Expertise
Have a strong ability to visualize how our data represents shoppers moving through spaces, and to use the best methodology to draw out the right answer, or develop new methodologies as needed
Identifying and surfacing challenges in the data or timelines to the Analytics Lead and providing thoughtful solutions
Project Work
Be a technical counterpart to REM team, translating pre-defined project specifications into accurate, clear and properly formatted outputs within established timelines
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization to surface any potential challenges with data, project scope or timelines
Attend meetings with the Retail Engagement Manager teams as needed to understand their needs and explain results, methodologies etc.

Skills:


Ability to be a data expert and successfully create and use best methodologies to solve customer questions or requests


Knowledge:


Understanding of Python in order to best address specific customer needs
Understanding of the RetailNext product to better answer customer questions as needed


Talents:


Ability to problem solve through customer issues and requests using RetailNext data


What's It Like to Work Here?


Remote-First Hybrid: Work anywhere + office access.
90-Day Work Anywhere: Work from anywhere for 90 days yearly.
Autonomy & Growth: Flexible schedules, ownership, career investment.
Customer Obsessed: Everything we do is for our clients.


Perks & Benefits


Best Self Allowance: Annual stipend for personal growth.
Recharge Days: Monthly company-wide day off.
Career Growth: We invest in you.


Join us and transform retail with data-driven insights! Apply now

Title: Power BI Consultant (DAX, SQL, Power Query, Dashboard, Reports) – Banking Client – Brussels
Description:
Power BI Consultant (DAX, SQL, Power Query, Dashboard, Reports) – Banking Client – Brussels

8 days onsite per month, the rest can be worked remotely
Rate: Circa €500 – €700 per day
Duration: 1 year contract




Role – Key responsibilities




As team member of the Support Project, Analytics, Reporting & Change squad, the incumbent will be expected to manage some run activities while contributing at the same time to a high degree of change and transformation.




Main activities:







Collaborate with other IT divisions and stakeholders to understand projects requirements
Develop and maintain dashboards & reports in Power BI
Design, create and manage interactive power BI dashboards to provide actionable insights to stakeholders
Perform data analysis and translate these findings into visually compelling reports
Integrate and transform data from multiple sources using Power Query, ensuring data accuracy and consistency
Monitor and optimize the performance of Power BI reports to ensure efficient data processing and quick response times
Ensure data accuracy, consistency and best visualization practices
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of data sources, data models, and user guides to facilitate knowledge sharing and continuity
Support the department in optimising the data analysis and reporting tools
Provide training and support to team members on Power BI functionalities







Required skills:

Technical knowledge and professional experience

Fully fluent in English is a mandatory requirement
3+ years of experience in Power BI development & data visualization
Strong expertise in DAX, Power Query, and data modelling
Experience in creating user-friendly, dynamic dashboards
Knowledge with SQL & integrating multiple data sources
Strong project and coordination management skills, ability to manage several projects simultaneously with various levels of complexity
Strong analytical skills and data-mindset, ability to identify actionable next steps and to draw conclusions and make recommendations in a concise way
Experience with documenting processes, controls and best practices
Familiarity with technology infrastructure, software and services commonly used in the industry

Personal & Behavioural skills

High level of attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Proactive mindset, independence, drive attitude
Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills to work effectively across divisions and locations

Please do send across an up to date CV to eobiechefu@welovesalt.com

Title: Senior Consultant in Data science
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



As a Senior consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:



Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing

You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia’s internal activities:



Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives

As fast as possible, you will take up team leadership roles and connect with colleagues of all levels.



Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.







In return, you can expect:



An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...


Qualifications


University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
2 to 6 years’ experience as a consultant
Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: HR Data Analyst & HRIS
Description:
📢 Opportunité chez la RTBF – HR Data Analyst & HRIS 📢

Vous êtes passionné(e) par l’analyse de données RH, les systèmes d’information et l’amélioration continue des processus RH ? La RTBF recherche un HR Data Analyst & HRIS pour un contrat de remplacement à Bruxelles, avec possibilité de télétravail partiel.




🎯 Vos missions :

✅ Concevoir, automatiser et maintenir les reportings et tableaux de bord RH

✅ Analyser les données et formuler des recommandations stratégiques

✅ Garantir la qualité des données RH et optimiser les processus SIRH

✅ Participer à la gestion administrative et au calcul des paies

✅ Assurer la conformité RGPD et la gestion des accès




💡 Votre profil :

🔹 Expérience en gestion des données RH et outils SIRH

🔹 Maîtrise des outils de reporting et d’analyse fonctionnelle

🔹 Capacité à travailler en équipe et à s’adapter aux changements

🔹 Sens de l’initiative et approche orientée amélioration continue




💼 Pourquoi rejoindre la RTBF ?

Travailler à la RTBF, c’est contribuer à un média global de référence, engagé dans sa mission d’information, d’éducation et de divertissement.

Intéressé(e) ? 📩 Postulez dès maintenant et rejoignez une équipe dynamique au cœur de la transformation digitale des RH !

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Intégrez une équipe innovante et dynamique dans le secteur de la mobilité, où vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le développement d'une application essentielle pour la région de Bruxelles. Nous recherchons un professionnel engagé prêt à transformer des données complexes en solutions pratiques.

En tant que Business Data Manager, vous êtes le lien entre les données et les décisions stratégiques. Si vous avez une expérience avérée dans l'analyse de données et en gestion de projets, nous serions ravis de vous compter parmi nous.

Vous collectez, analysez et interprétez les données générées par l'application Floya et ses outils connectés.
Vous collaborez étroitement avec l'équipe Floya pour orienter les décisions basées sur des analyses de performance.
Vous extrayez et nettoyez les données pour garantir leur qualité avant analyse.
Vous identifiez des indicateurs clés et développez des tableaux de bord personnalisés pour suivre les KPIs.
Vous présentez les conclusions de manière claire pour les parties prenantes non-expertes.
Vous gérez les relations avec les prestataires techniques et assurez l'intégration correcte des données.
Vous apportez des solutions pragmatiques aux défis rencontrés et soutenez les équipes dans leurs besoins métiers.

Requirements

Vous avez au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Business Data Manager ou Data Scientist.
Vous maîtrisez des outils comme Excel, Python, et Power BI pour l'analyse et la visualisation des données.
Vous avez une bonne compréhension des systèmes de gestion de bases de données tels que MySQL et le langage SQL.
Vous êtes un excellent communicateur.
Vous montrez une forte capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes.
Vous avez l'habitude de travailler en étroite collaboration avec diverses équipes.
Vous êtes capable de prendre des décisions basées sur des analyses stratégiques.
Vous êtes à l'aise avec la manipulation et le nettoyage des données pour garantir leur cohérence.
Vous êtes titulaire d'un Master en Data Science, Data Engineering ou IT.
Vous êtes fluide en anglais et avez une maîtrise native ou bilingue en français ou néerlandais.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description:

As a PowerApps and PowerAutomate Specialist, you will collaborate with the development team to enhance and optimize the application for managing civil protection operations. Your expertise will help expedite the development of complex components, ensuring the project’s success. Additionally, you will support the creation and formatting of PowerBI reports and ensure knowledge transfer so that the internal team can manage future updates and adjustments independently after the project’s completion.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the development team to design and enhance the civil protection operations application using PowerApps, PowerAutomate, and other Microsoft technologies.
Provide expert guidance on best practices, development strategies, and troubleshooting for complex components.
Assist in the creation of components related to intervention tracking, resource management, and material/equipment usage.
Transfer the necessary technical skills to in-house team members, enabling them to make future adjustments and additions independently.
Support the formatting and presentation of PowerBI reports to ensure effective and actionable data visualizations for monitoring and invoicing.
Assist with SharePoint integration and management to streamline data accessibility and collaboration.
Collaborate closely with the team to ensure smooth development processes and efficient problem-solving.

Required Skills & Expertise:

Expert level with SQL (experience managing, querying, and manipulating data).
Proven experience with PowerApps, PowerAutomate, PowerBI, Dataverse, and SharePoint.
Experience working with civil protection operations or similar industries (preferred, but not required).
Strong problem-solving abilities and troubleshooting expertise.
Excellent communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Proficiency in Dutch/French, English (active knowledge).

Show more
HTML:
Job Description:

As a PowerApps and PowerAutomate Specialist, you will collaborate with the development team to enhance and optimize the application for managing civil protection operations. Your expertise will help expedite the development of complex components, ensuring the project’s success. Additionally, you will support the creation and formatting of PowerBI reports and ensure knowledge transfer so that the internal team can manage future updates and adjustments independently after the project’s completion.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with the development team to design and enhance the civil protection operations application using PowerApps, PowerAutomate, and other Microsoft technologies.
  • Provide expert guidance on best practices, development strategies, and troubleshooting for complex components.
  • Assist in the creation of components related to intervention tracking, resource management, and material/equipment usage.
  • Transfer the necessary technical skills to in-house team members, enabling them to make future adjustments and additions independently.
  • Support the formatting and presentation of PowerBI reports to ensure effective and actionable data visualizations for monitoring and invoicing.
  • Assist with SharePoint integration and management to streamline data accessibility and collaboration.
  • Collaborate closely with the team to ensure smooth development processes and efficient problem-solving.

Required Skills & Expertise:

  • Expert level with SQL (experience managing, querying, and manipulating data).
  • Proven experience with PowerApps, PowerAutomate, PowerBI, Dataverse, and SharePoint.
  • Experience working with civil protection operations or similar industries (preferred, but not required).
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and troubleshooting expertise.
  • Excellent communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Proficiency in Dutch/French, English (active knowledge).

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Data & Reporting Analyst, vous travaillez pour le département Performance & Ponctualité, qui cherche à améliorer l'expérience des passagers grâce à des analyses basés sur les données, en améliorant la ponctualité de nos trains, en réduisant le nombre de trains annulés et en augmentant le pourcentage de correspondances réussies.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

En tant Data & Reporting Analyst, vous êtes responsable de l'analyse des données opérationnelles et du développement de rapports et dashboards. Vous apportez un soutien basé sur les analyses des données à d'autres services et équipes au sein de la SNCB et contribuez à l'amélioration de la ponctualité et de l'efficacité opérationnelle de l'organisation.

Voici une liste de vos différentes responsabilités :


Vous concevez, développez et améliorez des outils pour le suivi et l'analyse des performances et des différents paramètres de qualité des services ferroviaires de la SNCB (ex. ponctualité, annulations, correspondances, compositions des trains).
Vous effectuez des analyses complexes basées sur les données existanteset vous rapportez les résultats au sein de l'entreprise.
Par exemple, vous analysez l'impact des changements opérationnels structurels sur la ponctualité des trains (ex : la mise en œuvre du système de contrôle des trains européen (ETCS)).
Vous intégrez et harmonisez les données provenant de différentes sources et les présentez dans des dashboards compréhensibles et utilisables.
Vous maintenez et optimisez les rapports existants dans Power BI.
Vous développez des rapports KPI qui contribuent à améliorer l’efficacité et la ponctualité de nos trains. Vous répondez aux besoins et aux demandes de l'entreprise.


Un job fait pour vous ?

Vous possédez un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) et vous avez au moins 2 ans d'expérience en analyse de données.

De plus, vous possédez les compétences suivantes :


Vous avez une bonne connaissance de SQL et/ou Python. En outre, la connaissance de l'écosystème Microsoft Azure (Datafactory, AAS, Databricks, PowerBi...) est un atout.
Vous avez un esprit analytique et êtes prêt à vous approprier la matière complexe des opérations de transport d'un opérateur ferroviaire.
Vous avez la capacité de traduire des données complexes en informations opérationnels utilisables.
Vous communiquez facilement et comprenez les besoins et attentes du business.
Vous êtes à l'aise en français et avez une bonne connaissance de base du néerlandais.


Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

Choisir la SNCB, c'est choisir un environnement où vous pouvez apprendre et vous épanouir. Vous serez entouré de chouettes collègues qui vous soutiendront. Nous vous offrons un package salarial qui se compose de :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13eme mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, une voiture en leasing, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Ce défi vous parle ? Postulez à la SNCB !

Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillerez au sein de l’équipe « Data & Performance Management » dans le bâtiment Atrium, à deux pas de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi.

What’s next ?


Vous postulez en ligne.
Nous lisons votre CV et votre lettre de motivation avec grande attention. Nous vous appelons éventuellement pour faire plus ample connaissance.
Vous passez un premier entretien d’embauche dans lequel vous pourrez montrer votre motivation et vos compétences. Pour préparer cet entretien, vous complétez un questionnaire de personnalité.
Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous commencez votre premier jour de travail !


Nous nous réservons la possibilité d'ajuster ou de suspendre cette procédure en cas de nécessité.

Notre équipe de recrutement sélectionnera les profils les plus en adéquation avec les exigences du poste afin de garantir une correspondance optimale.

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
DATA ENGINEER




Content:

As a Data Engineer within the Customer domain you will work closely with the data (platform) team.
Your primary responsibility is to implement automated data pipelines to make data available for analytical purposes.
You ensure high data quality and perform necessary data cleansing actions.
You will discuss and fine-tune data requirements with the data owners and data analysts and perform data profiling to deliver a high-quality solution.




Who are we looking for:

You have proven experience in data engineering, preferably with AWS cloud-native services like S3, Athena, Glue, and Redshift.
You have in-depth knowledge of SQL, PL/SQL, DBT, SQLMesh, and Airflow.
You possess strong communication skills and work well in collaboration with different teams.
Experience with Oracle, Power BI, KNIME, or SAS is considered an advantage.
You have experience working with automated data pipelines and ensuring data quality.
Professional level of French & Dutch




For you:

You will have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies within the AWS cloud and implement advanced data solutions.
You will be part of a dynamic team where collaboration and personal growth are at the core.
You will play a key role in improving the performance and stability of the data platforms that are critical for the success of analytical processes.
You will work in an innovative environment where you will have the opportunity to further develop your skills and grow professionally.
Get fulltime asap started & Long-term project!




Interested? buna@recurv.be

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Career Area

Technology, Digital and Data

Job Description

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Are you passionate about customer success?

Caterpillar provides services to our customers far beyond the initial equipment sale. We leverage connected equipment and our decades of application expertise to enhance customer performance. Cat Digital exists to support enterprise efforts to deliver value-added services to customers. By enhancing customer value, Caterpillar and our dealers create the opportunity to profitably grow our businesses while reducing the impact of market cycles.

Services is where we are investing our time, talent and money because they drive value for our customers, our company and our dealers. If you have a passion for helping customers succeed and want to be part of growing services, now is a great time to join.

The Opportunity

This is a fixed-term contract for 12 months for the position of Data Analyst in the Service Backlog Team within the Cat Digital division. The Service Backlog Team’s mission is to deliver qualitative service leads through our digital application to our internal customers (industries and dealers) to drive services revenue through our digital product.

As a Data Analyst , your responsibility will be to leverage various datasets and develop/sustain services leads. You will also participate in specific projects aiming at further strengthening the service leads ecosystem. The position involves collaborating closely with team members, explaining lead management analytics to customers with limited data knowledge, and interacting with Data Engineers on technical details. The role also includes transforming data into service recommendations through creative approaches.

What You Will Do


Gather and implement business requirements for service leads development
Analyze feedback information to improve leads quality
Provide recommendations to internal partners based on quantitative and qualitative data
Improvement, enhancement and development of specific dataset based on opportunities
Drive processes improvement and automation of service lead generation application
Coordination with Engineering & BI Team
Users data support and training


What You Have


Master or bachelor's degree in Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, or Business administration.
Analytical skills: ability to interpret data to solve business issues & vulgarize results for a large and diverse audience.
Knowledge of business analysis; ability to recommend solutions that deliver value to stakeholders.
Decision Making and Critical Thinking skills; Effective Communications.
Good knowledge of SQL.


Top Candidates Will Also Have


Basic knowledge of Airflow and pipelines technologies.
Exposure to specific organizational tools such as Azure DevOps and GitHub.
Knowledge of Python and R.
Project management skills.


Additional Information


A valid Swiss work permit or Swiss or EU-25/EFTA citizenship is required for this position.
Hybrid work policy: 3 days per week from the Geneva office.


What We Offer

From day one, you’re set up to thrive at Caterpillar: helpful training, relatable mentors, global experience, competitive salary package, work-life balance, and the growth opportunities you expect with a Fortune 100 company.

You power our success, and we are committed to empowering yours. After all, when your work can impact the entire world, it’s important to do work that matters.

About Caterpillar

Caterpillar Inc. is the world’s leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, off-highway diesel and natural gas engines, industrial gas turbines and diesel-electric locomotives. For the past 100 years, we’ve been helping customers build a better, more sustainable world and are committed and contributing to a reduced-carbon future. Our innovative products and services, backed by our global dealer network, provide exceptional value that helps customers succeed.

Posting Dates

Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community .
