Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

Richemont International Distribution (RID) is looking for a highly motivated intern for a 6-month mission to support the Project& Logistics Performance team in optimizing logistics operations and performance analysis.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

This internship will provide you with hands-on experience in logistics performance management and master data. Your key responsibilities will include:


Logistics Reporting Support: Assist in setting up and improving logistics dashboards, ensuring alignment with global KPIs and reporting guidelines.
Performance Analysis: Identify opportunities for improvement by analyzing logistics KPIs, conducting cost studies, and proposing optimization levers.
Support for Periodic Reviews: Assist in daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly logistics performance reviews and help interpret key results.
Continuous Improvement: Participate in logistics optimization projects and develop new methodologies to enhance performance measurement.
Data Management Support: Use BI tools (Power BI, SAP, Celonis, SAC, GCP, Looker) to analyze and visualize logistics performance data.
Documentation and Standardization: Contribute to the structuring and updating of logistics KPI documentation and management routines.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?


You are currently pursuing a Master’s/Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field, with a strong interest in logistics, performance management, and data analysis.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable recommendations.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SAP, SQL and capable of structuring and managing databases.
Good understanding of logistics activities and performance-related challenges.
Proactive and autonomous, with the ability to structure your work and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Detail-oriented and rigorous, able to synthesize and communicate complex analyses effectively.
Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, to collaborate with various internal stakeholders.
Fluent in French and English.


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

At Richemont, we embrace a culture of performance and continuous improvement. We foster diversity, collaboration, and innovation, providing an engaging and dynamic environment to tackle tomorrow’s logistics challenges.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

If your application is selected, we will contact you for an initial discussion. You will then have the opportunity to meet the team and gain insights into the role’s challenges and expectations.

Ready to take on the challenge? Apply now!


Show more

  • You are currently pursuing a Master’s/Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field, with a strong interest in logistics, performance management, and data analysis.
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and provide actionable recommendations.
  • Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SAP, SQL and capable of structuring and managing databases.
  • Good understanding of logistics activities and performance-related challenges.
  • Proactive and autonomous, with the ability to structure your work and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Detail-oriented and rigorous, able to synthesize and communicate complex analyses effectively.
  • Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, to collaborate with various internal stakeholders.
  • Fluent in French and English.

WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

At Richemont, we embrace a culture of performance and continuous improvement. We foster diversity, collaboration, and innovation, providing an engaging and dynamic environment to tackle tomorrow’s logistics challenges.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

If your application is selected, we will contact you for an initial discussion. You will then have the opportunity to meet the team and gain insights into the role’s challenges and expectations.

Ready to take on the challenge? Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst/ML Engineer Intern
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Your internship

Join one of the teams building brand new systems with GenAI tools at its core. Drive the strategy for data intelligence by finding insights and grounding product decisions in the real world data. Solve real world problems with agentic AI systems, run large scale evaluations using LLMs and pave the way for the future of Digital Employee Experience. This internship offers a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of AI innovation, equipping you with the skills to make a real-world impact.

What You Will Do


Innovate with Latest Technologies: Conduct research, data analysis and LLM experiments leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies, commercial and open source.
Collaborate with Experts: Work closely with AI/ML researchers and software engineers using data insights to help developing and optimizing the state-of-the-art AI applications.
Contribute to Development: Actively participate in evaluation, integration, and deployment of your solution in the nexthink platform.
Communicate Your Insights: Present your findings and recommendations to the team and key stakeholders.


Qualifications


MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, ML or a relevant field
You love working with data and finding patterns and insights.
You are creative and happy to offer new ideas and solutions.
You have a good understanding of LLM technologies, Python data science libraries, SQL.
You are not afraid of software engineering tools: git, docker, AWS.
You have a drive for analytical problems and you like solving challenges, have a good team spirit and are happy to collaborate with the team.
You should also have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Professional level of written and spoken English skills are a must.


Additional Information

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

📍 Very good location next to the Prilly-Malley train station.

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Business/Data Analyst
Description:
Business/Data Analyst

Contract Duration: 12 months

Location: Visp (hybrid)




We are seeking a dedicated Business Analyst to join a leading Pharmaceutical company. You will support routine business operations, initiatives, and KPI reporting within our Program Management team.




Responsibilities:

Support PM Group in Data Analysis, Data Reporting, Forecast Accuracy, OTIF management, Revenue Monitoring and Systems support.
Produce up-to-date, accurate and relevant data analysis.
Check the forecast data in IBP and related BW reports.
SAP related tasks
Analyzes Revenue changes and clarifies root causes with responsible PM
Support communication and awareness in the PM team regarding forecast accuracy and monitors Risks and Issues.




Requirements:

• 3+ years of experience in a cGMP pharmaceutical, biotechnology or similar technical field

• Preferred field of study is accounting/IT/business

• Bachelor’s degree is required




If interested, please apply at the job post.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role

We are seeking a Data Analyst (Event Performance) to evaluate event ROI, marketing effectiveness, and attendee data, with a strong focus on AI events. This role requires a data-driven professional who can extract insights, optimize event strategies, and measure the impact of marketing efforts. The ideal candidate has extensive experience analyzing event performance and a deep understanding of AI industry trends.




Roles & Responsibilities:

Analyze event ROI, attendee behavior, and marketing performance metrics.
Develop data-driven insights to optimize future AI events.
Track and assess KPIs related to engagement, conversions, and sponsorship impact.
Collaborate with marketing and event teams to refine strategies based on analytics.
Present data findings through reports, dashboards, and visualizations.




Skills & Qualifications:

10+ years of experience in data analysis, event analytics, or related roles.
5+ years of experience analyzing AI event performance.
Proficiency in data analytics tools (Excel, SQL, Tableau, Google Analytics, etc.).
Strong understanding of event marketing metrics and audience segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving and data visualization skills.

Title: Data Business Analyst - Private Assets (Data Solutions)
Description:
To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.




Skills/Experience Required:

Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
Rigorous and analytical mindset
Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
Excellent attention to details
Very good communicator
Resistance to pressure and changing environment
Fluent in French and English




Responsibilities:

Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering & modelling techniques, business cases
Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%
Description:
Du suchst eine spannende Herausforderung in einem dynamischen, europaweit führenden Unternehmen? Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?

Dann bist du bei uns als




Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%




genau richtig! Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.

Was dich erwartet

Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad hoc Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Aufbereiten grosser Datenmengen
Selbstständige Weiterentwicklung der Reporting-Landschaft
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Pricing-Restrukturierung: Preiskalkulation & Konditionsmanagement
Abweichungsanalysen (Plan-Ist)
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten




Was dich auszeichnet

Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im (Marketing-/Vertriebs-) Controlling
Technisches und analytisches Verständnis
Umfangreiche IT-Kenntnisse (SAP, MS Office)
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch




Was wir bieten

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit deiner erfolgreichen Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.




Wer wir sind

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Kurzum: ein führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.

Wir freuen uns auf deine detaillierte Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) mit Lohnvorstellung, bevorzugt per E-Mail an: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Founded in Switzerland, Chaberton Professionals is the Management Recruitment division of Chaberton Partners, specializing in the search and selection of middle and senior management profiles. For the past seven years, we have reinforced our Swiss presence with key offices in Lugano, Zurich, Geneva, Lausanne, and Bern, supported by our team of 230 experienced Consultants and Board Members.




Data Analyst (m/f/d)




The position:

Our client is an industrial multinational player leader in its industry. To support the set-up of their global procurement Center of Excellence in Switzerland, we are supporting them in the search for an experienced Data Analyst based in Root, Lucerne.

The person will facilitate the procurement team with a centralized spend analytics database that supports data-driven decision making, identification of savings opportunities and savings tracking.




Main responsibilities:

Create and maintain the company’s global procurement database:

-Bring together spend data from multiple ERPs into one unified platform for analytics

-Normalize, cleanse, and classify data to support global analytics

-Ongoing spend data refresh from existing and new ERPs

Create and update category dashboards
Work with category leads to define useful analytics.
Design visualizations to present data in a clear and concise manner for relevant stakeholders.
Develop should cost modeling and support Category Leads in using model.
Develop total cost of ownership calculations and support Category Leads in using calculator
Track and report CoE value generation.
Support Business Partners in interfacing with Finance on reporting and budgeting.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Finance, or related field.
Experience in a similar role demonstrating strong analytics, data normalization and cleansing, ERP understanding, data visualization, and stakeholder management.
Ability to comfortably work with large datasets.
Demonstrated ability to partner with and manage internal stakeholders.
Proven experience in leveraging data analytics for strategic decision-making.
Strong financial reporting background with expertise in collaborating with finance teams.
Familiarity with advanced analytics tools and reporting frameworks.
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SQL, and/or Python.
Fluent spoken and written English, any other language is a plus.




Location: Root, Switzerland

Type of position: Permanent, full-time position




We care about each application. Should you not hear from us within two weeks, it would imply that we have proceeded with other candidates based on the specific requirements of the role. Please note that this decision does not reflect your skills or professional experience but is rather based on the specific needs and requirements of the current position.

Title: Data Analyst Senior (h/f) 80-100%
Description:
Tu as trouvé un poste qui correspond à tes compétences et tu es motivé/e à relever ce nouveau défi ? Postule et fais-toi connaître de nos spécialistes en recrutement.

TA MISSION


Tu conçois et réalises des analyses complexes, incluant la création de modèles sémantiques, de tableaux de bord et de rapports via Power BI et d’autres outils
Tu garantis la qualité, la performance et la fiabilité des analyses et des livrables
Accompagner les utilisateurs métiers dans le développement de leur autonomie sur les outils et analyses, via des formations ciblées et la diffusion des bonnes pratiques du self-service, est une de tes missions
Tu gères les projets analytiques : suivi des actions, coordination des parties prenantes et respect des délais
Tu industrialises les analyses via des processus automatisés (Power BI Service, GIT, Déploiement Pipeline)


Tes qualités


Power BI et les outils de visualisation sont tes alliés pour créer des solutions efficaces
SQL et Python sont tes langues de prédilection pour extraire, manipuler et analyser les données avec agilité
Transformer des besoins métiers en solutions analytiques concrètes est ton super pouvoir
Tes compétences relationnelles te permettent de collaborer harmonieusement avec des interlocuteurs variés
Autonomie, rigueur et sens de l’organisation sont tes maîtres mots dans ton travail
Proactif et orienté client, tu es toujours prêt à anticiper les besoins et à proposer des solutions innovantes


Ta formation


Tu as un diplôme universitaire ou HES en data science, statistiques, informatique ou toute formation équivalente


Ton expérience


Minimum 4-5 ans d’expérience en analyse de données, idéalement en environnement complexe ou multi-projets
Très bonne maîtrise de Power BI ainsi qu’une expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles
Tu as de l'expérience avec des plateformes cloud (Azure, Databricks, etc.)
Une expérience dans le secteur de l’assurance ou de la santé serait un plus


Fonction : Senior Data Analyst N06

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

Si toi aussi tu aimes l’entre-aide, la bienveillance et la proactivité, tu es à la bonne place !

Ici, au Groupe Mutuel, nous t’offrons la possibilité d’exercer une activité variée tout en favorisant un environnement de travail stimulant qui concilie ta vie privée ainsi que professionnelle. Tu te retrouveras dans une équipe où travail, rigueur mais surtout plaisir sont les mots d’ordre.

Entrée en fonction: Aussi vite que possible, mais aussi lentement que nécessaire!

HTML:
Tu as trouvé un poste qui correspond à tes compétences et tu es motivé/e à relever ce nouveau défi ? Postule et fais-toi connaître de nos spécialistes en recrutement.

TA MISSION

  • Tu conçois et réalises des analyses complexes, incluant la création de modèles sémantiques, de tableaux de bord et de rapports via Power BI et d’autres outils
  • Tu garantis la qualité, la performance et la fiabilité des analyses et des livrables
  • Accompagner les utilisateurs métiers dans le développement de leur autonomie sur les outils et analyses, via des formations ciblées et la diffusion des bonnes pratiques du self-service, est une de tes missions
  • Tu gères les projets analytiques : suivi des actions, coordination des parties prenantes et respect des délais
  • Tu industrialises les analyses via des processus automatisés (Power BI Service, GIT, Déploiement Pipeline)

Tes qualités

  • Power BI et les outils de visualisation sont tes alliés pour créer des solutions efficaces
  • SQL et Python sont tes langues de prédilection pour extraire, manipuler et analyser les données avec agilité
  • Transformer des besoins métiers en solutions analytiques concrètes est ton super pouvoir
  • Tes compétences relationnelles te permettent de collaborer harmonieusement avec des interlocuteurs variés
  • Autonomie, rigueur et sens de l’organisation sont tes maîtres mots dans ton travail
  • Proactif et orienté client, tu es toujours prêt à anticiper les besoins et à proposer des solutions innovantes

Ta formation

  • Tu as un diplôme universitaire ou HES en data science, statistiques, informatique ou toute formation équivalente

Ton expérience

  • Minimum 4-5 ans d’expérience en analyse de données, idéalement en environnement complexe ou multi-projets
  • Très bonne maîtrise de Power BI ainsi qu’une expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles
  • Tu as de l'expérience avec des plateformes cloud (Azure, Databricks, etc.)
  • Une expérience dans le secteur de l’assurance ou de la santé serait un plus

Fonction : Senior Data Analyst N06

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

Si toi aussi tu aimes l’entre-aide, la bienveillance et la proactivité, tu es à la bonne place !

Ici, au Groupe Mutuel, nous t’offrons la possibilité d’exercer une activité variée tout en favorisant un environnement de travail stimulant qui concilie ta vie privée ainsi que professionnelle. Tu te retrouveras dans une équipe où travail, rigueur mais surtout plaisir sont les mots d’ordre.

Title: Global Data Analyst - Sustainability ofi Coffee
Description:
Olam Food Ingredients

Job Description

As global data analyst for the Coffee division, you will have close interaction with our teams of agronomists and sustainability experts across our business. This implies working with a multicultural team in 18 origins (countries). Besides a proven expertise and passion for numbers (and coffee) we are looking for a proactive person willing to take on a big challenge in a dynamic company with plenty of growth opportunities.

What will you work on?


To analyze data related to agricultural practices and sustainability in coffee supply chains in ofi – coffee operations
To coordinate with ofi digital on system upgrades or developments of our data collection platform OFIS
To assist and guide origins teams on the correct use of the OFIS data collection platform
To provide guidance to origins for data collection (design surveys, training material, outlier identification, sample methodologies and monitoring)
To improve data management systems, focusing on data quality
To support data integration between different platforms
To provide periodic analysis reports to the origin teams, focusing on data intelligence and data performance (quality)
To communicate the value of data through dashboards (for central and origin decision making and reporting, and for external stakeholders)
To work on what if scenarios or simulations to forecast outcomes and impacts from sustainability interventions.
To assess GHG emission reduction from the implementation of different practices.
To highlight insights, trends and other findings that help central decision-making processes.
To cover Sustainability Programs data requirements (baselines, impact measurement, using external and internal tools)
To continuously update and communicate global metrics.


Requirements


Bachelor's in engineering, Agroforestry, Business/Economic or similar
Advanced English and Spanish (min. B2)
Minimum 6 months experience in data management and analysis
Knowledge of agriculture and/or sustainability (like yield, seasonal effects)


Technical Knowledge


Statistical and analytical tools (R, Python, or Stata)
Data visualization tools (Power BI)
MS Office tools, advanced Excel
Knowledge in GIS is a plus


Expectations


Good at data management
Meticulous & thorough in transversal analyzing multiple data points
Being Proactive
High motivation to work independently in a multicultural environment
Good social skills, getting the origins on board and equipped.


Availability to travel to coffee operations, if required

By joining ofi you'll become part of one of the most fast-growing and sustainable organizations in food- and agri business. You'll get the responsibilities that fit you and the job, and lots of room for initiative in an open and informal organisation.
Show more

Title: Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern
Description:
Algrano is a Swiss tech startup transforming the global coffee trade through transparency and digitalization. Our online marketplace connects coffee farmers directly with roasters in Europe and the USA, supported by logistics, insurance, and financing. Honored with the Best Innovation award by the European Coffee Industry Association in 2015 for our launch and again in 2022 for our achievements, we currently serve over 1,000 sellers and roasters in more than 50 countries.

We are building a scalable data warehouse to enhance analytics and reporting. As a Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern, you’ll help structure data, define business needs, and improve accessibility. You’ll also support BI tool selection, and report consolidation.

Tasks

As a Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern, you will work directly with the CTO, Christian, and collaborate with key stakeholders, including engineers Zmago and Vladi, as well as a cross-functional business team. You will play a crucial role in shaping Algrano’s data infrastructure, ensuring data is structured, accessible, and optimized for analytics.

‍

Your main responsibilities will include:

Defining business requirements: Engage with stakeholders to understand key reporting needs.
Data preparation and transformation: Use SQL views and Python scripts to extract and process data.
Structuring the data warehouse
BI tool selection and setup: Support the evaluation, configuration, and implementation of our analytics tool.
Report consolidation: Migrate and optimize existing reports into the selected analytics platform.

‍

You will own the analytics workflow post-data warehouse, ensuring reports provide value and align with business insights.

Requirements

We are looking for a candidate with:

Background in Data Science, Engineering, or Analytics (or relevant studies/experience).
Experience with Data Warehouse concepts and design principles
Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy in data reporting.
Experience with SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Familiarity with Python for data processing and automation.
Understanding of data modeling concepts (fact/dimension tables, OLAP databases).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in an iterative, evolving data environment.
Interest in Business Intelligence tools and analytics infrastructure.
Benefits
6-month internship (approx. 2 days per week on average). The duration can be extended, and a higher weekly commitment is possible. Location: Zurich, with the option for home office. However, we prefer if the candidate can come to the office occasionally. Flexible working hours and days – we understand academic commitments and exams. You will be part of a growing and talented team that is striving towards our vision of creating ​a prosperous and connected global coffee community You will be working in an exciting expansion phase of the company as we come towards our 10th anniversary Your work will truly make a difference within the company, creating meaningful change; helping producers and roasters to create stronger supply chains and more resilient businesses that will help these independent entrepreneurs to thrive We are dedicated and have bold ambitions to create change. We also offer flexible working hours and 5 weeks of holidays and a real community office culture.
Show more

Title: BI Consultant / Data Analyst
Description:
80 - 100%

Ihre Aufgaben


Sie übernehmen die Applikationsverantwortung unserer bestehenden Business Intelligence und Reporting Plattform (SAP BW / BO), gewährleisten einen reibungslosen Betrieb (2nd Level) und stellen Datenintegrität sicher.
Sie übernehmen den Lead für die Konzeption und Umsetzung unserer zukünftigen Datenlandschaft und -Plattform und leisten somit einen zentralen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung von Viollier zu einer «data/insight driven organisation».
Sie erarbeiten eine zukunftsfähige Datenarchitektur, entsprechende Datenmodelle und setzen diese kollaborativ und mit Entschlossenheit um.
Sie beraten unsere internen Kunden, übersetzen gemeinsame Anforderungen in technische Spezifikationen für BI-Lösungen und schulen und befähigen die Anwender im Bereich der eingesetzten BI- Systemen.
Sie koordinieren externe Lieferanten bei der Umsetzung von Projekten im Bereich Daten, Reporting und Business Intelligence.


Sie bringen mit


Hochschulabschluss in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine verwandte Fachrichtung, mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung
Ausgeprägte konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten sowie Kenntnisse im Bereich zukunftsfähiger Daten- und Applikationsarchitekturen
Praktische Erfahrung mit SAP BW / SAP BO, Kenntnisse von SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, DataBrix, MS PowerBI oder weiteren Produkten von Vorteil
Erfahrung in Projektmanagement & interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit, sowie Koordination von Projekten und externen Partnern
Kommunikationsstärke mit guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen, Französischkenntnisse sind von Vorteil


Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?

Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung. Offene Fragen beantwortet Ihnen gerne Frau Isabelle Marti, T +41 61 486 15 53.
Show more

Title: Data Business Analyst - Private Assets (Data Solutions)
Description:
Job Description:

Data Business Analyst (Private Assets)

We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.

Skills/Experience Required:

Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
Rigorous and analytical mindset
Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
Excellent attention to details
Very good communicator
Resistance to pressure and changing environment
Fluent in French and English

Responsibilities:

Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering & modelling techniques, business cases
Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.

Title: Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

Activités

Job Dimension:

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:


Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat


Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more

  • Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
  • Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
  • Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
  • Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
  • Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
  • Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.


Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat

  • Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
  • 2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
  • Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Process Analytics Technician (m/w/d)
Description:
Process Analytics Technician

Aktuell suchen wir einen Process Analytics Technician. In dieser Position sind Sie verantwortlich für die Installation und Wartung von Prozessanalysegeräten und -systemen und arbeiten eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen.

Hauptaufgaben und Verantwortung:

Sicherstellung der optimalen Verfügbarkeit von Prozessanalysegeräten sowie deren sichere und vorschriftsmäßige Installation und Inbetriebnahme.
Instandhaltung von Prozessanalysengeräten als wesentlicher Bestandteil der Prozesssicherheit und Emissionsüberwachung.
Kalibrierung vorhandener Analysegeräte und Installation neuester Analysegeräte.
Planung und Durchführung von Projekten unter Berücksichtigung von Terminen und Kosten.
Verantwortung für die Qualität und Sicherheit der Prozessanalytik-Ausrüstung.

Qualifikationen und Erfahrung:

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung in einem relevanten technischen oder naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich.
Erfahrung in der chemischen Industrie ist wünschenswert.
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.
Vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen in der Prozessanalytik sowie in der Wartung von Spektrometern und GCs.
Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Entscheidungsfreude.
Selbstständige Arbeitsweise und analytisches Denken sind für die Wartungstätigkeiten unerlässlich.

Rahmenbedingungen:

Laufzeit: 6-12 Monate (genaueres wird noch bekannt gegeben)
Standort: Visp


Sthree Switzerland is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Data Engineer - Python, SQL, Data Modelling
Description:
Data Engineer - Python, SQL, Data Modelling - This is a long-term contract opportunity for our Zürich based client within the Financial Services sector.

Your tasks:

Implement a solution for data multi-tenancy and seeding of data from different source system environments on the clients data landscape which runs on Azure Databricks
Performing analysis, design and implementation work
Making changes across multiple areas of the solution i.e. application code, data storage and Azure platform


Your experience/knowledge:


Strong Python development skills
Good database knowledge including data modelling and SQL
Experience of writing code, testing of code via automation, refactoring, measuring and optimizing performance
Language skills: English



Your soft skills:


Excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail
A high degree of self-organisation and time management
Analytical and solution-orientated thinking






Location:Zürich, Switzerland
Work setting:Onsite (Some remote)
Sector:Financial Services
Start:ASAP
Duration:8 months +
Workload:100%
Ref.Nr.:BH 22751



Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.
Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.
Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.
We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Data Engineer - Zurich
Description:
Data Engineer - Freelance - Zurich
Location: Onsite in Zurich for 4 days per week (1 day remote)
Availability: Full-time
Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: Until the end of the year + extensions

Our client is urgently seeking a Data Engineer to implement a solution for data multi-tenancy and seeding of data from different source systems. This role requires proficiency in Microsoft Azure, particularly in Azure Databricks, and experience with making changes across multiple areas of the solution, including application code, data storage, and Azure platform.

Key Responsibilities:

Perform analysis, design, and implementation work with Python, PySpark, SQL, and the Azure platform.
Implement a solution for data multi-tenancy and data seeding within the data landscape running on Azure Databricks.
Work in close collaboration with a team in Zurich and other team members across various locations, as part of a Finance Transformation project.
Manage work tracking in Azure DevOps.
Contribute to multiple solution areas (application code, data storage, Azure platform).

Essential Skills and Experience:

At least 7 years of experience as a data/software engineer in financial services firms, with a proven track record of writing and operating code in production interacting with relational databases.
Strong proficiency in Python, with the ability to be productive immediately.
Advanced knowledge of databases, including data modelling and SQL (DML and DDL).
In-depth understanding of Azure.
High levels of proactivity, drive, and practicality.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal.

Desired Skills and Qualifications:

Experience with Azure Databricks, PySpark, and Unity Catalog.

Interested?
If this role is of interest, please send an up-to-date CV to taylor.lewis@darwinrecruitment.com.


Darwin Recruitment AG is a Zurich based, SECO licensed, privately owned subsidiary of Darwin Professional Staffing Group Ltd (a Global IT Recruitment Consultancy).




Darwin Recruitment AG manages client relationships whilst also utilising Darwin Professional Staffing Group databases and networks to source Candidates and fulfil client requests.




We do not ask for a placement fee from Candidates/Employees.




If you wish to contact a specialist regarding this role, or your job search in general, please contact +41 (0)43 456 29 09

Title: Data Analyst & Process Optimization Specialist, 80 - 100%
Description:
Job Reference #
312335BR

Job Type
Vollzeit

Your role
Bist du ein Fan davon, Prozesse zu verbessern und hast die Skills, das selbst in die Hand zu nehmen? Routine ist nicht dein Ding und du liebst es, dich immer wieder neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen? Pragmatismus liegt dir im Blut und du findest einfache, umsetzbare Lösungen und clevere Workarounds für die verschiedensten Business-Prozess-Probleme? Du möchtest ständig Neues lernen und hast großes Interesse daran, in unsere Businessprozesse und Daten einzutauchen? Dann bist du genau die richtige Person für diese Rolle:


Analyse und pragmatische Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen zur Steigerung der Effizienz.
Entwicklung und Optimierung von Berichten mit Tableau oder Power BI.
Erstellung und Pflege von Excel-Tabellen, einschließlich der Definition von Makros und Skripten zur Automatisierung.
Nutzung von Python zur Prozessoptimierung
Durchführung von Datenanalysen zur Identifizierung von Trends und Mustern usw.
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Teams


Your team
Das Team «Digitalisierung" ist im Businessbereich Corporate & Real Estate Banking angesiedelt. Wir haben zum Ziel das tägliche digitale Banking für unsere Kunden zum Kinderspiel zu machen und unsere Kundenberater mit den besten digitalen Werkzeugen auszustatten. Unsere Tools sorgen für eine effiziente und transparente Zusammenarbeit über alle Kanäle hinweg. Wir suchen dich, um pragmatische Lösungen für die «Pain Points» in unseren digitalen Business-Prozessen zu finden und umzusetzen.

Wenn du Spass daran hast, dich mit unterschiedlichen Problemstellungen auseinanderzusetzen und kreative pragmatisch umsetzbare Lösungen zu entwickeln, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!

Your expertise


2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Analyse und Optimierung von Geschäftsprozessen.
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Excel, einschließlich der Definition von Makros und Skripten.
Umfassende Erfahrung in der Erstellung und Optimierung von Berichten mit Tableau oder Power BI.
Anwendungsnahe Kenntnisse mittels Python Prozesse pragmatisch zu optimieren
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse.
Fähigkeit zur Identifizierung und Lösung von Problemen.
Kreativität und Innovationskraft bei der Entwicklung von Lösungen.
Flexibel und neugierig
Fähigkeit zur Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen (kundennahen-) Teams zur effizienten Entwicklung und Implementierung von Lösungen.
Sehr gute Englisch Kenntnisse, Deutsch und/oder Französisch/Italienisch grosser Mehrwert


About Us
UBS ist die weltweit grösste und einzige wirklich globale Vermögensverwalterin. Wir sind in vier Geschäftsbereichen tätig: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management und Investment Bank. Unsere globale Reichweite und die Breite unserer Expertise heben uns von unseren Mitbewerbern ab.

Wir sind an allen wichtigen Finanzplätzen in mehr als 50 Ländern präsent.

How We Hire

Es kann sein, dass wir Sie dazu auffordern, während des Bewerbungsprozesses ein oder mehrere Einstufungstests durchzuführen. Erfahren Sie mehr darüber (EN)

Join us
Bei UBS unterstützen wir flexible Arbeitsmodelle, wenn die Rolle es zulässt. Das beinhaltet unterschiedliche Arbeitsmodelle, wie Teilzeit, Job Sharing oder hybrides Arbeiten (im Büro und von zu Hause). Unser Purpose, unsere Unternehmenskultur sowie unsere globale Infrastruktur unterstützen uns dabei, auf agile Weise zusammenzuarbeiten und gleichzeitig alle Kundenbedürfnisse zu erfüllen

Neue Erfahrungen in verschiedenen Rollen sammeln oder sich neue Kenntnisse und Fähigkeiten aneignen – wir wissen, dass grossartige Arbeit niemals alleine geleistet wird. Wir wissen, dass es unsere Mitarbeitenden mit ihren einzigartigen Hintergründen, Fähigkeiten, Erfahrungen und Interessen sind, die unseren Erfolg vorantreiben. Gemeinsam bewirken wir so viel mehr!

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert. Wir respektieren alle Mitarbeitenden als Individuen sowie unterschiedliche Kulturen, Perspektiven, Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen unseres Personals.

Title: Tableau Administrator
Description:
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Tableau Administrator (m/w/d) to join team in Zurich.




As a Tableau Admin, you will oversee the administration and maintenance of Tableau environments. Your role encompasses managing security, performance tuning, upgrade planning, and user training. Your expertise will ensure high availability and scalability of Tableau solutions, enabling stakeholders to visualize and interpret data effectively.




Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:




Perform installation, migration and upgrade of Tableau Servers and Desktops under High Availability scenario
Design, develop, and maintain Tableau reports and dashboards
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver high-quality solutions on time.
Troubleshoot issues related to data integration, ETL processes, and SQL queries in Tableau.
Provide technical support to end-users on the usage of Tableau tools.
Perform performance analysis of existing Tableau Servers and make Best Practice recommendations
Perform day to day administration of Tableau Servers
Manage sites and projects
Configure and manage project permissions
Provide periodic reports on Tableau Server usage
Publish Tableau workbooks and data extracts
Configure and maintain Active Directory integration with Tableau Server
Administer and maintain Tableau Server and Tableau Online environments.
Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues as routine maintenance tasks and optimize system performance.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions
Identify improvement areas in Environment hosting and upgrade processes.
Implement best practices for data governance and security.
Support and train end-users on Tableau functionality and data visualization techniques.
Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports as needed.
Coordinate with other IT and data teams to integrate Tableau with various data sources.
Plan and execute upgrades and patch management for Tableau software.




Your profile:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related fields or equivalent work experience required
5 years of professional experience in Tableau Administration
Demonstrable experience in providing technical support to Tableau users, addressing issues related to cloud connectivity and data access.
Experience with Tableau Server, Tableau Online, SQL, Data Visualization, Dashboard Design Shell Scripting, Data Governance Performance Tuning
Strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate with various teams.
Good understanding of database concepts including writing SQL statements
Good understanding of Agile process
Strong troubleshooting skills
Fluent in English




Summary about project




Duration: 6 months with an option for the extension
Location: Zürich
Working hours: Normal business hours, 40 hours per week
Languages: English

Title: Analyst Cloud Data & AI (all genders)
Description:
Effective Field


As an Analyst in Cloud Data & AI, you are part of an innovative team in Zurich that is shaping the future of cloud solutions and AI technologies.
You support the development and implementation of tailored Data & AI solutions that help our clients optimize their processes and gain new insights.
Your creative ideas are in demand when it comes to transforming complex data into clear, action-oriented insights.
You work with modern cloud environments, such as AWS and Azure, and have the opportunity to participate in exciting projects that deepen your knowledge.
With your assistance in data visualization, we enable our clients to understand the stories behind their data.


What distinguishes you


You are passionate about the world of technology and hold a University degree in computer science, business informatics, or a similar field.
With profound experience in programming, preferably in Python or Java, as well as knowledge of cloud technologies such as AWS, you make the difference.
You are curious about AI solutions, enjoy developing innovative software, and have a high affinity for IT.
Your structured and careful approach to designing solutions sets you apart.
Your strong team spirit and trustworthy personality make you a valued team member.
You speak fluent English.


What you can expect


You will become part of a community that values appreciation and support, and looks forward to shaping your path together.
Our modern valantic office in Zurich offers a comfortable atmosphere with lots of fun.
An environment where you can bring your own ideas and experience growth.
Flexible working hours and the possibility for home office, which allow you to optimally combine your practical experience with your career.
Insights into leading digital cloud & AI projects that expand your expertise and promote your development.
Diverse opportunities for networking and collaboration with experienced colleagues and mentors who share your passion for technology.

  • You support the development and implementation of tailored Data & AI solutions that help our clients optimize their processes and gain new insights.
  • Your creative ideas are in demand when it comes to transforming complex data into clear, action-oriented insights.
  • You work with modern cloud environments, such as AWS and Azure, and have the opportunity to participate in exciting projects that deepen your knowledge.
  • With your assistance in data visualization, we enable our clients to understand the stories behind their data.

What distinguishes you

  • You are passionate about the world of technology and hold a University degree in computer science, business informatics, or a similar field.
  • With profound experience in programming, preferably in Python or Java, as well as knowledge of cloud technologies such as AWS, you make the difference.
  • You are curious about AI solutions, enjoy developing innovative software, and have a high affinity for IT.
  • Your structured and careful approach to designing solutions sets you apart.
  • Your strong team spirit and trustworthy personality make you a valued team member.
  • You speak fluent English.

What you can expect

  • You will become part of a community that values appreciation and support, and looks forward to shaping your path together.
  • Our modern valantic office in Zurich offers a comfortable atmosphere with lots of fun.
  • An environment where you can bring your own ideas and experience growth.
  • Flexible working hours and the possibility for home office, which allow you to optimally combine your practical experience with your career.
  • Insights into leading digital cloud & AI projects that expand your expertise and promote your development.
  • Diverse opportunities for networking and collaboration with experienced colleagues and mentors who share your passion for technology.

Title: Graduate Management Trainee
Description:
ABOUT US

LocalBini is the go-to platform for cultural, fun or exclusive city Experiences across Europe with Locals. From a secret boutique shopping Experience with a gemologist, to wine-tasting with an expert sommelier, LocalBini.com features authentic city Experiences that people can book based on their interests (eg. art, architecture, foodie, nightlife, history etc.).




ABOUT THE GRADUATE PROGRAM: TECH SAVVY OPERATIONS MAESTRO

Unlock the power of data and statistics in our 24-month graduate program at LocalBini. We're seeking analytical minds who thrive on challenges and want to make a lasting impact. Dive deep into startup operations, gaining a holistic view of the organization while working alongside management.

As a selected Candidate, you'll not only be an integral part of day-to-day activities but also leverage your data skills to support and launch projects. Your role will involve consulting with management and other teams to enhance processes using the latest technologies, including ChatGPT/AI.




REQUIREMENTS

Completed Master Degree in Data Science, Physics, Statistics or a related field.
Active mindset & flexible, out-of-the-box thinking to tackle complex challenges.
Fluent in English, and proficiency in either German OR French.




WHAT WE OFFER

An outstanding graduate program providing profound insights into the entire organization and a helicopter perspective on running a technology company.
A full-time position at LocalBini upon successful completion of the Program.
Competitive graduate program salary to cover living expenses in Switzerland.




Commence your 24-month journey in St. Gallen, Switzerland, for the initial 18 months, gaining a comprehensive understanding of our operations. Subsequently, embark on a transformative 6-month mission abroad, broadening your experience and impact. The program culminates with a full-time role at your preferred office location- Berlin, Poznan, or St. Gallen- enabling you to contribute directly to LocalBini's success.




HOW TO APPLY

Ready to embark on this exciting journey? Submit your application as one long pdf file including:

a) Resume showcasing your academic and professional achievements.

b) Cover letter highlighting your passion for data-driven decision-making.

c) Relevant references that demonstrate your execution capabilities.




Join us in shaping the future of LocalBini!

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst

Type: Full-Time

Start Date - ASAP

Location – Geneva, Switzerland




JOB DESCRIPTION:




My client, a leader in their field is looking for a Senior Quantitative Analyst to assist in supporting the Trading Desks day-to-day. Helping the desks understand Risk / PnL, discussing and developing Trading Tools (Excel, Python) and enhancing the existing analytics library (C++).




DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




The role represents an excellent opportunity for a Quant to work alongside Interest Rate and FX Traders, understand how these markets behave and deliver trading tools and analysis. You will be required to stay up to date on the latest technologies and market developments and researching these and implementing where appropriate.

The primary asset classes in focus will be Rates and FX - with some exposure to Credit and Equity.




Duties will involve:

Day-to-day support of Trading Desks
Maintain and build Front Office Trading/Analysis tools
Potential to develop core analytics library
Dialogue with Traders, Risk Managers and other departments as necessary
Deputise for the Head of Quant Analysis as required




EXPERIENCE:




5-10 years hands-on experience as a FO Quant/Strat
Knowledge and a passion for Interest Rate and/or FX markets and analytics
Good degree in a quantitative discipline




TECHNICAL SKILLS:

Essential

Python
Excel/VBA




Desirable

C++
ML / AI
SQL

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Engineer specialized in Azure Databricks to support the implementation of a data lakehouse solution. You will collaborate with data architects, analysts, and engineers to design, build, and deploy scalable and efficient data processing frameworks to enhance data-driven decision-making capabilities within the organization.

Responsibilities


Implement and optimize data ingestion pipelines using Azure Databricks
Develop scalable and reliable data transformation and processing solutions
Collaborate closely with stakeholders and technical teams to align data strategies and architecture
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security within the data lakehouse


Provide guidance on best practices for data management within Azure environments

Qualifications


Proven experience in data engineering with a strong focus on Azure Databricks
Solid expertise in building data lakehouse architectures
Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Storage, and related Azure cloud services
Strong skills in SQL, Python, and Spark
Excellent understanding of data governance, data quality, and security best practices
Effective communicator capable of working independently and collaboratively
Proficiency in German is a nice-to-have


Ideal Candidate:


Comfortable with fully remote collaboration while engaging actively with Zürich-based stakeholders
Highly organized, proactive, and adaptable


What We Offer


A focused freelance mission with clear objectives and deliverables
Potential opportunity for future collaboration depending on project needs
The chance to work remotely while contributing significantly to sustainability and energy-efficiency initiatives


We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Big Data/ PySpark Engineer – 600 - 675 CHF Per Day – 6 Month Contract (Likely Extensions) – Investment Banking – Zurich (Hybrid)




Role & Responsibilities:

Conceptualize and design big data system involving Hadoop, PySpark, Hive.
Design functional and technical architectures
Develop applications on the big data platform using open source programming languages
Work closely with Administrator, Architect and Developers

10+ years of IT experience with in-depth big data technology
Extensively worked on Python and pyspark Programming
Experience in building complex data pipelines using Spark and especially PySpark
Experience in performance tuning Spark application.
Experience in scheduling and running spark applications.
Experience in Airflow, Databricks & Azure is added plus
Hands-on experience with fundamental Hadoop tools and technologies
Knowledge on Cluster management and storage mechanism in Big Data Cloud

600 - 675 CHF
6 months (likely extensions)
Zurich, Switzerland

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Science Internship (12 months)
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.

Transforming Waste into Value

At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers; we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

Job Description

The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:


Support the specification of technical requirements, technical design of ML based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).


Qualifications


Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English both written and verbal
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning


Additional Information

We offer


Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Excellent employment conditions
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
Modern infrastructure


For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.
Show more

Title: Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern
Description:
Algrano is a Swiss tech startup transforming the global coffee trade through transparency and digitalization. Our online marketplace connects coffee farmers directly with roasters in Europe and the USA, supported by logistics, insurance, and financing. Honored with the Best Innovation award by the European Coffee Industry Association in 2015 for our launch and again in 2022 for our achievements, we currently serve over 1,000 sellers and roasters in more than 50 countries.

We are building a scalable data warehouse to enhance analytics and reporting. As a Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern, you’ll help structure data, define business needs, and improve accessibility. You’ll also support BI tool selection, and report consolidation.

Tasks

As a Data Engineering & Insights Analyst Intern, you will work directly with the CTO, Christian, and collaborate with key stakeholders, including engineers Zmago and Vladi, as well as a cross-functional business team. You will play a crucial role in shaping Algrano’s data infrastructure, ensuring data is structured, accessible, and optimized for analytics.

‍

Your main responsibilities will include:

Defining business requirements: Engage with stakeholders to understand key reporting needs.
Data preparation and transformation: Use SQL views and Python scripts to extract and process data.
Structuring the data warehouse
BI tool selection and setup: Support the evaluation, configuration, and implementation of our analytics tool.
Report consolidation: Migrate and optimize existing reports into the selected analytics platform.

‍

You will own the analytics workflow post-data warehouse, ensuring reports provide value and align with business insights.

Requirements

We are looking for a candidate with:

Background in Data Science, Engineering, or Analytics (or relevant studies/experience).
Experience with Data Warehouse concepts and design principles
Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy in data reporting.
Experience with SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Familiarity with Python for data processing and automation.
Understanding of data modeling concepts (fact/dimension tables, OLAP databases).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in an iterative, evolving data environment.
Interest in Business Intelligence tools and analytics infrastructure.
Benefits
6-month internship (approx. 2 days per week on average). The duration can be extended, and a higher weekly commitment is possible. Location: Zurich, with the option for home office. However, we prefer if the candidate can come to the office occasionally. Flexible working hours and days – we understand academic commitments and exams. You will be part of a growing and talented team that is striving towards our vision of creating ​a prosperous and connected global coffee community You will be working in an exciting expansion phase of the company as we come towards our 10th anniversary Your work will truly make a difference within the company, creating meaningful change; helping producers and roasters to create stronger supply chains and more resilient businesses that will help these independent entrepreneurs to thrive We are dedicated and have bold ambitions to create change. We also offer flexible working hours and 5 weeks of holidays and a real community office culture.
Show more

You will be part of a growing and talented team that is striving towards our vision of creating ​a prosperous and connected global coffee community You will be working in an exciting expansion phase of the company as we come towards our 10th anniversary Your work will truly make a difference within the company, creating meaningful change; helping producers and roasters to create stronger supply chains and more resilient businesses that will help these independent entrepreneurs to thrive We are dedicated and have bold ambitions to create change. We also offer flexible working hours and 5 weeks of holidays and a real community office culture.

Title: BI Consultant / Data Analyst
Description:
80 - 100%

Ihre Aufgaben


Sie übernehmen die Applikationsverantwortung unserer bestehenden Business Intelligence und Reporting Plattform (SAP BW / BO), gewährleisten einen reibungslosen Betrieb (2nd Level) und stellen Datenintegrität sicher.
Sie übernehmen den Lead für die Konzeption und Umsetzung unserer zukünftigen Datenlandschaft und -Plattform und leisten somit einen zentralen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung von Viollier zu einer «data/insight driven organisation».
Sie erarbeiten eine zukunftsfähige Datenarchitektur, entsprechende Datenmodelle und setzen diese kollaborativ und mit Entschlossenheit um.
Sie beraten unsere internen Kunden, übersetzen gemeinsame Anforderungen in technische Spezifikationen für BI-Lösungen und schulen und befähigen die Anwender im Bereich der eingesetzten BI- Systemen.
Sie koordinieren externe Lieferanten bei der Umsetzung von Projekten im Bereich Daten, Reporting und Business Intelligence.


Sie bringen mit


Hochschulabschluss in Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine verwandte Fachrichtung, mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung
Ausgeprägte konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten sowie Kenntnisse im Bereich zukunftsfähiger Daten- und Applikationsarchitekturen
Praktische Erfahrung mit SAP BW / SAP BO, Kenntnisse von SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, DataBrix, MS PowerBI oder weiteren Produkten von Vorteil
Erfahrung in Projektmanagement & interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit, sowie Koordination von Projekten und externen Partnern
Kommunikationsstärke mit guten Deutsch- und Englischkenntnissen, Französischkenntnisse sind von Vorteil


Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?

Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung. Offene Fragen beantwortet Ihnen gerne Frau Isabelle Marti, T +41 61 486 15 53.

Title: Data Business Analyst - Private Assets (Data Solutions)
Description:
Job Description:

Data Business Analyst (Private Assets)

We want candidate who holds recent experience as well as who is more inclined on Advisory BA (order management) not IT BA.

To act as a talented Business Analyst in our team dedicated to the business line Alternative Advisors, for which we develop and maintain custom-made applications and integrate COTS packages. Today, our applications run on premises, but we have started our journey to the public cloud. In that future environment, we are building new data pipelines using modern cloud-native technologies and leverage SaaS business solutions.

Skills/Experience Required:

Mandatory practical experience in Finance, and Private Assets as business analyst, business engineer
Previous experience with eFront and underlying data
Advanced capabilities in SQL, XLS (DBT and Python are a plus)
Collaborative mindset - Have proven experience where his/her capacity to foster collaboration has made a strong difference
Relevant practical experience working with agile framework
Experience of SaaS business solution integration is a plus, in particular in Alternative Investment
Rigorous and analytical mindset
Passion for continuous improvements. Not satisfied with the status quo and always thinking of ways to improve
An intuitive eye for customer needs beyond the obvious
Excellent attention to details
Very good communicator
Resistance to pressure and changing environment
Fluent in French and English

Responsibilities:

Functional and technical support of agile Data projects in the financial sector/banking environment throughout the entire life cycle
Specifying requirements as a business analyst using requirements engineering & modelling techniques, business cases
Developing solutions with internal and external stakeholders
Actively contribute to internal topics and implement your own ideas - thereby driving your own professional, methodological, and personal development and that of your environment
Establishing data quality assessment rules aligned with business lines to assist data engineers in automating calculations and report generation.
