Title: Quantitative Analyst, Power & Gas
Description:
Job Title:

Quantitative Analyst, Power & Gas

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

The Quantitative Analyst is part of the Power and Gas team, delivering advanced analytics for the power and gas trading desk within Gunvor, ideally based in London. They are responsible for providing high quality insights in the products markets across the Power/Natural Gas spectrum.

Main Responsibilities:


In-depth expertise in evaluating and assigning value to physical assets
Assist the traders with ad hoc market analysis / insights.
Maintain and improve existing pricing models
Identify the right set of models and develops the right code / package to execute them.
Evaluate the validity of the model (both scientifically as well as from a business perspective). Maybe rephrase(?) Understand the model limitations and the difference between model output and market fundamentals
Generate trade ideas based on model outputs & Articulate insights and recommendations (based on model output) to respective key stakeholders.
Support Origination activity and investment decisions.
Communicating technical jargon in plain English to colleagues within the team.
Prepare various reports and analysis for publishing internally.
Maintain and improve teams IT capabilities.
Develop systematic trading strategies for the Power/Natural Gas Market.



Profile / Key Skills

The ideal candidate has strong background in quantitative skills (like statistics, mathematics, advanced computing, machine learning) and has applied those skills in solving real world problems, particularly in the power & gas business. The required expertise includes (but is not limited to):


Natural Gas Modelling: Advanced experience with different forms of Power/Natural Gas modelling: Stack, Bid Offer, Interconnector.
Applied Machine learning techniques: Good to have latest applied machine knowledge to improve models
Statistics / Mathematics: Data Quality Analysis, Data identification, Hypothesis testing, distribution / probability theory.
Data Science: Time series analysis, Object Oriented Programming, Business intelligence, Databases.
Fundamental Knowledge: Good to understand the European Power/Natural Gas markets from fundamental perspective.



Minimum Requirements


Between 3 and 8 years in a similar role in the Natural Gas Trading sector.
Advanced university degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Quantitative Science or Finance.
In depth knowledge of analytics tools and technologies: Python, R, MATLAB.
Mastery other computing language is a plus
Microsoft Office tools: excellent Excel skills (VBA).
Excellent interpersonal communication and influencing skills.
Excellent presentation skills.
Eagerness to learn and ability to work with limited supervision.
Curious and Proactive, rigorous and meticulous.
Highly numerate.
Strong team spirit.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.



If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: Power quantitative analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies is targeting to build a portfolio of 100 GW of renewables by 2030 and to become one of the main player in renewables worldwide. This will be achieved through many investment projects (2-4 b$/year). Trading Power will contribute to this ambition by managing financial and physical power and risks of the renewables portfolio on open markets. TEM (Trading Energy Management) performance team aims at supporting TEM in creating a profitable and sustainable portfolio by providing analyses of the profitability and risks of its different businesses (PPA portfolio, short term optimisation, etc…).

As Power Quantitative Analyst, you will develop models to support risk analyses, fundamental modelling, hedging strategies and investment decisions and make recommendation to Structured Portfolio traders and senior management. This will require dealing with complex technical and theoretical problems requiring quantitative approaches.

Activités

What you will do:

As a Power Quantitative Analyst your main responsibilities will be the following:


Specify, design & implement mathematical models to handle pricing issues & risk assessment of a portfolio of renewables assets and backtest & optimise models performance.
Run regular risk analysis of the portfolio, analyse hedging strategies and portfolio effect, and make recommendation to traders and senior management.
Work closely with structured portfolio and short term traders to support them in specific risk & pricing analysis
Manage IT-related questions (deployment, QA) directly with IT and Trading Systems team (Python / AWS / TFS) and support Trading support function (MO, operations …) with the takeover of tools developed by the team
Develop and maintain an understanding of Trading Power desks businesses and stay up to date regarding their positions and products.
Ensure support to other TGP and GRP teams on quant-related issues that may arise on their regular activity.



Profil du candidat


You hold a Master’s degree in Economics, Mathematics or Engineering
You have a first experience in a Power Trading environment
Strong modelling and analytical skills with strong attention to detail with first experience in quantitative modelling.
Basic knowledge of European and US energy markets
Programming skills (Python/ SQL/R/) and/or visualization frameworks (PowerBI/Streamlit,.) will be appreciated
Ability to work under pressure, rigor, proactivity and creativity
Good communication skills, ability to explain complex issues and present them in a clear and neat manner.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

Activités

Job Dimension:

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Activities:


Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Accountabilies:

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.

Profil du candidat


Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Process Analytics Technician (m/w/d)
Description:
Process Analytics Technician

Aktuell suchen wir einen Process Analytics Technician. In dieser Position sind Sie verantwortlich für die Installation und Wartung von Prozessanalysegeräten und -systemen und arbeiten eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen.

Hauptaufgaben und Verantwortung:

Sicherstellung der optimalen Verfügbarkeit von Prozessanalysegeräten sowie deren sichere und vorschriftsmäßige Installation und Inbetriebnahme.
Instandhaltung von Prozessanalysengeräten als wesentlicher Bestandteil der Prozesssicherheit und Emissionsüberwachung.
Kalibrierung vorhandener Analysegeräte und Installation neuester Analysegeräte.
Planung und Durchführung von Projekten unter Berücksichtigung von Terminen und Kosten.
Verantwortung für die Qualität und Sicherheit der Prozessanalytik-Ausrüstung.

Qualifikationen und Erfahrung:

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung in einem relevanten technischen oder naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich.
Erfahrung in der chemischen Industrie ist wünschenswert.
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.
Vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen in der Prozessanalytik sowie in der Wartung von Spektrometern und GCs.
Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Entscheidungsfreude.
Selbstständige Arbeitsweise und analytisches Denken sind für die Wartungstätigkeiten unerlässlich.

Rahmenbedingungen:

Laufzeit: 6-12 Monate (genaueres wird noch bekannt gegeben)
Standort: Visp


Sthree Switzerland is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

HTML:
Process Analytics Technician

Aktuell suchen wir einen Process Analytics Technician. In dieser Position sind Sie verantwortlich für die Installation und Wartung von Prozessanalysegeräten und -systemen und arbeiten eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen.

Hauptaufgaben und Verantwortung:

  • Sicherstellung der optimalen Verfügbarkeit von Prozessanalysegeräten sowie deren sichere und vorschriftsmäßige Installation und Inbetriebnahme.
  • Instandhaltung von Prozessanalysengeräten als wesentlicher Bestandteil der Prozesssicherheit und Emissionsüberwachung.
  • Kalibrierung vorhandener Analysegeräte und Installation neuester Analysegeräte.
  • Planung und Durchführung von Projekten unter Berücksichtigung von Terminen und Kosten.
  • Verantwortung für die Qualität und Sicherheit der Prozessanalytik-Ausrüstung.

Qualifikationen und Erfahrung:

  • Abgeschlossene Ausbildung in einem relevanten technischen oder naturwissenschaftlichen Bereich.
  • Erfahrung in der chemischen Industrie ist wünschenswert.
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.
  • Vorteilhaft sind Erfahrungen in der Prozessanalytik sowie in der Wartung von Spektrometern und GCs.
  • Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Entscheidungsfreude.
  • Selbstständige Arbeitsweise und analytisches Denken sind für die Wartungstätigkeiten unerlässlich.

Rahmenbedingungen:

  • Laufzeit: 6-12 Monate (genaueres wird noch bekannt gegeben)
  • Standort: Visp

Sthree Switzerland is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Senior Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Swissblock Technologies

Swissblock Technologies is a private investment firm dedicated to pioneering cryptocurrency integration with cross-asset investing. Applying a quantitative view to financial markets, we manage systematic multi-strategy portfolios of digital and traditional assets.




Our Systematic Crypto Group transforms market insights into robust algorithmic investment strategies, trading fully automated on our prop trading infrastructure. We are dedicated to a collaborative, non-siloed environment with shared incentives, where each member can directly shape the team’s and company's future.




This role can based from anywhere in Switzerland.




Responsibilities and Objectives

Quantitative Researchers in our Systematic Crypto Group have the opportunity to drive the research process from ideation to final implementation, ultimately specialising according to individual strengths and preferences. This will involve to

Analyse the crypto ecosystems to uncover the fundamental dynamics that drive price and risk formation.
Utilise advanced statistical techniques on both traditional and crypto-specific data sets.
Conceptualised and enhanced monetisation systems for trading signals and other market anomalies.
Implement, backtest, and deploy algorithmic trading strategies within a live trading environment.
Monitor live strategy performance and integrate insights into the research loop.
Participate in the development of our research agenda based on research findings and ideas.




Skills and Talents

Advanced degree in a highly quantitative field.
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail; ability to maintain a pragmatic mindset.
Passion for traditional and crypto markets; driven to model the underlying market dynamics.
Ability to conduct data-driven research focused on solving real-world problems.
Dedication to continuous learning and making an impact; willingness to question the status quo.
Ability to effectively summarise and clearly communicate research results.
Prior exposure to quantitative research (preferably in digital assets).
Proficiency in Python and experience in using statistical packages.




Culture

Swissblock Technologies offers an exciting and diverse environment with flat hierarchies and excellent peers. We are a profitable company with a culture based on responsibility and merit. Empowerment of each individual team member is a key value reflected in our career dynamics, which continuously grow with the business.




In addition to a modern office in Baar, Switzerland – flexibility to work remotely within Switzerland – we propose a competitive compensation package, an annual bonus, 25 days of annual leave, progressive social benefits, and engaging company events.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Big Data/ PySpark Engineer – 600 - 675 CHF Per Day – 6 Month Contract (Likely Extensions) – Investment Banking – Zurich (Hybrid)




Role & Responsibilities:

Conceptualize and design big data system involving Hadoop, PySpark, Hive.
Design functional and technical architectures
Develop applications on the big data platform using open source programming languages
Work closely with Administrator, Architect and Developers




Technical Requirements:

10+ years of IT experience with in-depth big data technology
Extensively worked on Python and pyspark Programming
Experience in building complex data pipelines using Spark and especially PySpark
Experience in performance tuning Spark application.
Experience in scheduling and running spark applications.
Experience in Airflow, Databricks & Azure is added plus
Hands-on experience with fundamental Hadoop tools and technologies
Knowledge on Cluster management and storage mechanism in Big Data Cloud




Rate/ Duration:

600 - 675 CHF
6 months (likely extensions)
Zurich, Switzerland

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Engineer specialized in Azure Databricks to support the implementation of a data lakehouse solution. You will collaborate with data architects, analysts, and engineers to design, build, and deploy scalable and efficient data processing frameworks to enhance data-driven decision-making capabilities within the organization.

Responsibilities


Implement and optimize data ingestion pipelines using Azure Databricks
Develop scalable and reliable data transformation and processing solutions
Collaborate closely with stakeholders and technical teams to align data strategies and architecture
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security within the data lakehouse


Provide guidance on best practices for data management within Azure environments

Qualifications


Proven experience in data engineering with a strong focus on Azure Databricks
Solid expertise in building data lakehouse architectures
Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Storage, and related Azure cloud services
Strong skills in SQL, Python, and Spark
Excellent understanding of data governance, data quality, and security best practices
Effective communicator capable of working independently and collaboratively
Proficiency in German is a nice-to-have


Ideal Candidate:


Comfortable with fully remote collaboration while engaging actively with Zürich-based stakeholders
Highly organized, proactive, and adaptable


What We Offer


A focused freelance mission with clear objectives and deliverables
Potential opportunity for future collaboration depending on project needs
The chance to work remotely while contributing significantly to sustainability and energy-efficiency initiatives


We are looking forward to your application!

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making. 

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

How You Can Make An Impact


Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent



What We Are Looking For:

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently



Consulting and Communication Skills:


Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops



Technical Expertise:


Strong Engineering and/or Mathematics background
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Requisition ID:17116

Title: Working Student Data Science 40-60%
Description:
Are you excited about data analytics and data products? Are you interested in managing, organizing as well as connecting with people? Then, we want to get to know you! Our team Data Analytics & Artificial Intelligence is responsible for providing easy access to data insights as well as foster innovation around data to help both our organization and our customers to run business smarter and grow.




As a modern, dynamic and innovative company, we offer a wide range of opportunities to develop your potential in the exciting world of technology and finance. We support you in your career entry, invest in your development and the expansion of your personal skills. As a "Working Student" you will be part of our Young Talents Community and join a network of dedicated career starters.







What you will do

Maintaining and extending the data portfolio powering our data products by performing data retrieval and validation
Data model calibration for our data products, ensuring accurate data representation and reliable predictions
Maintenance and development of data and reporting pipelines
Support the development of our data products, in particular with functional testing and validation of our software




What you bring

Current studies (Bachelor or Master) preferably in the fields of computer science, mathematics, data science, business informatics / engineering or economics
Fast comprehension, reliability and trustworthiness with a detail-oriented working style
First programming skills in Python or SQL
Team player with a proactive personality
Fluent in German and English is a requirement for this position

Title: Market Analyst
Description:
For motivated candidates we offer the chance to belong to one of the top producers and marketers of commodities and to be part of a specialized, international and diverse team within the Ferroalloys / Nickel Department.

The Main Tasks And Responsibilities Include


Collecting, compiling, analysing, and presenting quantitative and qualitative data on the global Nickel market, Stainless Steel, Batteries, and Ferroalloy markets
Maintaining and developing a structured approach to the storage and analysis of statistical information, including supply, demand and trade data, stock movements, macroeconomic indicators, and cost of production models
Assimilating information sourced from the company’s extensive network of field offices and from external industry sources and contacts
Identifying market trends and economic developments affecting the international Nickel, Stainless Steel, and Ferroalloy markets, and to provide real time feedback and ideas on the markets to the relevant trading teams in Baar
Developing and maintaining internal technical reports and models


The ideal candidate


has advanced analytical skills
has a high level of personal credibility, with the authority to build respect and trust at all levels of a company
is team-oriented and collaborative
has a genuine interest in building and sustaining positive relationships with key internal and external stakeholders
has a good ability to navigate complexity and act strategically, along with a readiness to accommodate shifting priorities


Qualifications And Requirements


A degree or equivalent qualification an applicable/related field
1-3 years of experience in an analytical or business intelligence role preferred, but not a requirement. Graduates with the right demonstrable skills may also be considered
Analytical skills, with the ability to review data, spot trends and identify key drivers
Good IT skills including standard applications, operating systems, databases, Excel
Advanced presentation, research, and verbal / written communication skills
Fluent in English spoken and written (corporate language)
Holding a Swiss work permit or passport holder of CH / EU


Benefits


We are committed to providing benefits, which promote mental, physical, and financial well-being. From healthy meal options in our restaurants and bistros to free use of the in-house gym including sport classes with professional trainers.
We reimburse public transport for commuting to work; alternatively, we offer free parking space.
We provide tuition assistance for further education and training courses.
We have a competitive parental leave policy. Our childcare benefits also include emergency childcare services and financial assistance towards daycare costs.
Employees’ Swiss Pension 2nd pillar is fully paid by Glencore.


Who We Are

Glencore is one of the world’s largest global diversified natural resource companies and a major producer and marketer of more than 60 commodities that advance everyday life. Through a network of assets, customers and suppliers that spans the globe, we produce, process, recycle, source, market and distribute the commodities that support decarbonisation while meeting the energy needs of today.

With over 150,000 employees and contractors and a strong footprint in over 35 countries in both established and emerging regions for natural resources, our marketing and industrial activities are supported by a global network of more than 50 offices.

Glencore’s customers are industrial consumers, such as those in the automotive, steel, power generation, battery manufacturing and oil sectors. We also provide financing, logistics and other services to producers and consumers of commodities.

Glencore is proud to be a member of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights and the International Council on Mining and Metals. We are an active participant in the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative.

We will support the global effort to achieve the goals of the Paris Agreement through our efforts to decarbonise our own operational footprint. We believe that we should take a holistic approach and have considered our commitment through the lens of our global industrial emissions. Against a restated 2019 baseline, we are targeting to reduce our Scope 1, 2 and 3 industrial emissions by 15% by the end of 2026, 25% by the end of 2030, 50% by the end of 2035 and we have an ambition to achieve net zero industrial emissions by the end of 2050, subject to a supportive policy environment. For more information see our 2024-2026 Climate Action Transition Plan and the About our emissions calculation and reporting section in our 2023 Annual Report, available on our website at glencore.com/publications.

Note*: All applications will be subject to potential background checks. You will be informed if this will be the case. Further information about the processing of your personal data will be made available during the application process. We'll seek your explicit consent prior to processing the data.

Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

  • In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
  • Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Title: Data Engineer (Snowflake)
Description:
For our client, a leading Pharmaceutical company based in the kanton of Basel, we are currently looking for a Data Engineer




The perfect candidate has minimum 1-2 years experience working with Snowflake’s cloud data platform and is proficient in programming languages such as Python. Additionally we are looking for someone who is experienced with SQL for querying and managing databases. English must be fluent for this role.




Tasks & Responsibilities:

Design and implement scalable and efficient data storage and data processing solutions within Snowflake.
Write, optimize, and troubleshoot business owned and developed tables, views, functions and SQL queries within the Snowflake environment.
Ensure data security and compliance with industry standards.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet data-driven business objectives.
Potentially integrate Snowflake with ServiceNow.




Must Haves:

Minimum 1-2 years experience working with Snowflake’s cloud data platform.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python (and/or Java, C++, or Scala.)
Experience with SQL for querying and managing databases.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and architecture.
Familiarity with concepts like ETL/ELT processes
Performance tuning abilities
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS
Experience using cloud-native tools and services.
Show more

For our client, a leading Pharmaceutical company based in the kanton of Basel, we are currently looking for a Data Engineer


The perfect candidate has minimum 1-2 years experience working with Snowflake’s cloud data platform and is proficient in programming languages such as Python. Additionally we are looking for someone who is experienced with SQL for querying and managing databases. English must be fluent for this role.

  • Design and implement scalable and efficient data storage and data processing solutions within Snowflake.
  • Write, optimize, and troubleshoot business owned and developed tables, views, functions and SQL queries within the Snowflake environment.
  • Ensure data security and compliance with industry standards.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet data-driven business objectives.
  • Potentially integrate Snowflake with ServiceNow.

  • Minimum 1-2 years experience working with Snowflake’s cloud data platform.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python (and/or Java, C++, or Scala.)
  • Experience with SQL for querying and managing databases.
  • Understanding of data warehousing concepts and architecture.
  • Familiarity with concepts like ETL/ELT processes
  • Performance tuning abilities
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS
  • Experience using cloud-native tools and services.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Die hostettler ag sursee bietet alles für Motor- und Fahrradbegeisterte. Sie ist Inbegriff für den Import von Motorrädern, Rollern und Elektrozweirädern der Marke Yamaha sowie Bekleidung und Zubehör von bekannten Topmarken, unter anderem mit der führenden Schweizer Eigenmarke iXS. Wir suchen per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine motivierte und talentierte Persönlichkeit.

Aufgabengebiet


Entwicklung von innovativen Data Warehouse Lösungen auf Basis von Microsoft-Technologien
Entwurf von skalierbaren Datenmodellen für das Data Warehouse sowie der Data Marts im Bereich Materialwirtschaft, Finanzen und HR
Aktive Mitwirkung an der gesamten Entwicklungskette im Data Warehouse von SQL Server Integration Services über T-SQL bis hin zur CPM / BI Lösung Board und der Entwicklung von Reports
Unterstützung der Daten-Analyse und -Integration durch enge Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Fachabteilungen


Profil


Abgeschlossenes Informatik-, Medieninformatik-, oder Wirtschaftsinformatik-Studium
3-5 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich DWH/BI
T-SQL und SQL Server, sowie SSIS sind Schwerpunkte, Kenntnisse in Board / BI von Vorteil
Mehrjährige Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung (relational und multidimensional)
Stilsichere Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Freude komplexe Zusammenhänge zu analysieren und innovative, praxisnahe und nachhaltige Lösungen zu erarbeiten
Hohe Eigeninitiative, die Fähigkeit zur zielgruppengerechten Kommunikation sowie Teamfähigkeit zeichnen Sie aus


Was wir bieten


Ein innovatives Unternehmen in einem zukunftsorientierten Marktumfeld
Gründliche Einarbeitung und aufgestellte Arbeitskollegen und -kolleginnen
Ein spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege
Interne und externe Weiterbildungsangebote mit Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten
Gleitzeitmodell und 5 Wochen Ferien (ab 50 Jahren: 6 Wochen)
Möglichkeit von Homeoffice und Ferienkauf
Attraktive Mitarbeiterkonditionen auf alle Produkte der hostettler group
Vielseitige Events und Veranstaltungen
...und viele weitere Benefits!


Sind Sie interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung!

Bewerbungsdossiers von Personalvermittlungsstellen werden nicht berücksichtigt.

Title: Analyst Cloud Data & AI (all genders)
Description:
Dein Wirkungsfeld


Als Analyst im Bereich Cloud Data & AI bist du Teil eines innovativen Teams in Zürich, das die Zukunft von Cloud-Lösungen und KI-Technologien gestaltet.
Du unterstützt die Entwicklung und Implementierung maßgeschneiderter Data & AI-Lösungen, die unseren Kunden helfen, ihre Prozesse zu optimieren und neue Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen.
Deine kreativen Ideen sind gefragt, wenn es darum geht, komplexe Daten in klare, handlungsorientierte Erkenntnisse zu transformieren.
Du arbeitest mit modernen Cloud-Umgebungen wie AWS und Azure und hast die Möglichkeit, an spannenden Projekten teilzunehmen, die dein Wissen vertiefen.
Durch deine Unterstützung bei der Datenvisualisierung ermöglichen wir es unseren Kunden, die Geschichten hinter ihren Daten zu verstehen.



Was Dich auszeichnet


Du bist leidenschaftlich an der Welt der Technologie interessiert und verfügst über einen Universitätsabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem ähnlichen Fachgebiet.
Mit bereits fundierten Erfahrungen in der Programmierung, vorzugsweise in Python oder Java, sowie Kenntnissen in Cloud-Technologien wie AWS, machst du den Unterschied.
Du bist neugierig auf KI-Lösungen, entwickelst gerne innovative Software und hast eine hohe Affinität zur IT.
Deine strukturierte und sorgfältige Herangehensweise an die Gestaltung von Lösungen zeichnet dich aus.
Dein starker Teamgeist und deine vertrauenswürdige Persönlichkeit machen dich zu einem geschätzten Teammitglied.
Du sprichst fließend English.



Darauf kannst Du Dich freuen


Du wirst Teil einer Gemeinschaft, die Wert auf Wertschätzung und Unterstützung legt und sich darauf freut, gemeinsam deinen Weg zu gestalten.
Unsere modernes valantic Büro in Zürich bietet eine angenehme Atmosphäre mit viel Spaß.
Ein Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du deine eigenen Ideen einbringen und Wachstum erleben kannst.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zum Homeoffice, die es dir ermöglichen, deine Praxis optimal mit deiner Karriere zu kombinieren.
Einblicke in führende digitale Cloud- & KI-Projekte, die deine Expertise erweitern und deine Entwicklung fördern.
Vielfältige Möglichkeiten zum Networking und zur Zusammenarbeit mit erfahrenen Kollegen und Mentoren, die deine Leidenschaft für Technologie teilen.

Show more

Title: Stagiaire Data Analyst – Process Mining & R Shiny - 100%
Description:
Description De L'entreprise

Avec plus de 12'000 collaborateurs et collaboratrices représentant 160 métiers, les Hôpitaux Universitaires de Genève sont un établissement de référence au niveau national et international. Pour en savoir plus sur notre institution, prenez quelques minutes pour consulter notre rétrospective 2024 en cliquant ici.

DéCLIC (Déploiement Coordonné et à Large échelle des Itinéraires Cliniques) est un programme institutionnel ayant comme objectif l’amélioration continue de la qualité et de l’efficience des soins en diminuant notamment la variabilité des pratiques pour les patients et patientes d’un même groupe et en renforçant la coordination interprofessionnelle.

Ce programme, initié dans le cadre du plan stratégique Vision 20+5, est soutenu par la Direction médicale et la Direction des soins.

Grâce à une approche collaborative entre les spécialités médicales et les équipes pluriprofessionnelles, le programme DéCLIC soutient la mise en œuvre d’initiatives innovantes pour offrir aux patients et patientes des soins de qualité.

Description Du Poste

Dans le cadre du plan stratégique 20+5, le programme DéCLIC vise à déployer les itinéraires cliniques de manière coordonnée dans l’ensemble des services cliniques des HUG. Une équipe dédiée collabore avec les professionnels médicaux-soignants de terrain pour améliorer la prise en charge des patients et patientes.

Le Process Mining vient enrichir cette démarche en visualisant les données, soit pour confronter les idées reçues et mieux objectiver la réalité, soit pour révéler de nouvelles connaissances permettant de formuler des propositions d’amélioration.

Souhaitant se positionner comme leader dans l'utilisation de cette approche et face à l'intérêt croissant de divers corps de métier pour cette méthode novatrice, les HUG ont décidé de développer un outil standardisé. Cet outil facilitera la création de diagrammes de Process Mining et permettra un ancrage plus large de son utilisation avec les cliniciens.

Vous aurez pour mission de soutenir l’ingénieur en charge du développement du Process Mining. Vos missions principales seront de contribuer à la création d’un outil en R, basé sur des codes existants, et de réaliser des analyses sur les Itinéraires Cliniques en exploitant cet outil et en organisant avec les cliniciens et cliniciennes.

Voici vos responsabilités liées à ce stage :

Vous standardisez la génération de diagrammes de Process Mining à partir des codes existants en R.

Vous développez une interface en R Shiny afin de créer une application autonome pouvant être utilisée par des super-utilisateurs.

Vous êtes force de proposition pour faire évoluer l’outil et son application

Vous réalisez des analyses en lien avec les Itinéraires Cliniques :

Comprendre et synthétiser les besoins des équipes terrain.

Extraire les données des bases de données structurées (SQL).

Utiliser l’outil développé pour générer des diagrammes de Process Mining.

Interpréter les résultats, les confronter aux attentes des professionnels et affiner l’analyse pour formuler des recommandations pertinentes.

Présenter les résultats aux professionnels concernés.

Qualifications

Vous réalisez un Master en ingénierie, informatique ou sciences des données, avec des connaissances en analyse de flux et statistiques avancées.

Vous possédez excellente maîtrise de R (analyses statistiques et visualisation de données) ainsi que des connaissance en SQL pour l’extraction de données.

Vous avez une aisance avec les outils bureautiques standards (Microsoft Office).

Vous avez une expérience en développement d’interfaces en R Shiny.

Votre familiarité avec les processus hospitaliers et l’économie de la santé serait un plus.

Votre expérience réussie dans un poste ou projet similaire est souhaitée.

Informations supplémentaires


Entrée en fonction : Dès que possible
Nombre de poste : 1
Taux d’activité : 100%
Contrat : Contrat de stage de 6 mois (soumis à convention)
Délai de candidature : 21.04.2025
Demande de renseignements : Mme. A. Huchet, responsable Déclic, 079 553 61 78 ou Dr. Aimad Ourahmoune, 079 553 11 44


Votre dossier de candidature doit comporter une lettre démontrant votre motivation, votre curriculum vitae, les copies des diplômes et attestations requis pour le poste et les 2 derniers certificats de travail.

Cette annonce s'adresse indistinctement aux femmes et aux hommes.

Seules les candidatures soumises via la plateforme de recrutement sont prises en compte. Les candidatures papier et mail ne seront pas traitées.
Show more

Vous possédez excellente maîtrise de R (analyses statistiques et visualisation de données) ainsi que des connaissance en SQL pour l’extraction de données.

Vous avez une aisance avec les outils bureautiques standards (Microsoft Office).

Vous avez une expérience en développement d’interfaces en R Shiny.

Votre familiarité avec les processus hospitaliers et l’économie de la santé serait un plus.

Votre expérience réussie dans un poste ou projet similaire est souhaitée.

Informations supplémentaires

  • Entrée en fonction : Dès que possible
  • Nombre de poste : 1
  • Taux d’activité : 100%
  • Contrat : Contrat de stage de 6 mois (soumis à convention)
  • Délai de candidature : 21.04.2025
  • Demande de renseignements : Mme. A. Huchet, responsable Déclic, 079 553 61 78 ou Dr. Aimad Ourahmoune, 079 553 11 44

Votre dossier de candidature doit comporter une lettre démontrant votre motivation, votre curriculum vitae, les copies des diplômes et attestations requis pour le poste et les 2 derniers certificats de travail.

Cette annonce s'adresse indistinctement aux femmes et aux hommes.

Seules les candidatures soumises via la plateforme de recrutement sont prises en compte. Les candidatures papier et mail ne seront pas traitées.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Main Purpose:We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our Market Liquidity team. This is an exciting new opportunity to work on XVA pricing models as well as contributing to a Quant Library in a dynamic and leading commodity house.Knowledge Skills and Abilities, Key Responsibilities:

Very strong analytical and mathematical skill

Comfortable with derivatives modelling concepts

Strong Python programming skills & experience, C++ and others a plus

Attention to details

Demonstrable team skills both within and across teams

Ability to pick up new concepts and think outside the box quickly

Ability to deliver fast and efficient programming solutions

Key Responsibilities

Developing and maintaining methodologies and quantitative tools

Liaising with stakeholders across the business (Traders, MO, Risk, Credit, IT)

Assess the risk (xVA) associated to every new transaction.

Competencies

Masters or higher numerate degree in one of the following Maths/Engineering/Physics/Science/Finance

Must have 5+ years working, preferably in an XVA quantitative business in commodity, including CVA/FVA, but could be rates and currencies products as well

Candidates with experience in exotic/non-linear products might also be considered

Experience in delivering production quality code, including use of source control, continuous integration, unit and regression testing

Key Relationships and Department Overview:

Key Relationships

Traders

MO

Risk

Credit

IT

Reporting Structure

- Reporting XVA Manager, Oil, LNG & Gas trading

Equal Opportunity Employer

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse workforce! We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or handicap, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Junior Consultant / System Engineer 100%
Description:
Du suchst den beruflichen Einstieg in der Welt der modernen IT?

Du hast gute Grundkenntnisse in der Informatik und bist eine kommunikative Persönlichkeit? Wir haben die Chance für dich!




Viele renommierte Talente in der IT-Berufswelt haben ihren Weg als Quereinsteiger begonnen. Trotzdem scheint der Markt für den Einstieg oft verschlossen – keiner öffnet die Tür.

Wir schon. Denn wir wissen: Talent schlägt Titel.

Wir sind die Firma, die dir DIE Chance gibt, dich zu beweisen. Wir suchen langfristige Beziehungen. Menschen, mit und auf denen wir aufbauen können und uns im Gegenzug Ihre Loyalität entgegenbringen. Wir bieten dir dafür die Chance, als (Quer) Einsteiger deine berufliche Zukunft in der IT zu starten und begleiten dich in deinem Lernprozess.




Wir bei ITConcepts machen Unternehmen durch exzellentes Knowhow und State of the Art Technologien produktiver und gestalten so den Weg in die Zukunft. Sei dies im Bereich IT Service Management, IT Operation Management, Identity Access Management, IT Security oder Big Data Analytics. Als unabhängiger IT-Berater bieten wir stets die Lösung an, die am besten zu den individuellen Bedürfnissen unserer Kunden passt.

Was ITConcepts dir bietet

Familiäre und von Vertrauen geprägte Unternehmenskultur
Flache Hierarchie mit pragmatischen Entscheidungswegen
Cooles, diverses und aufgestelltes Team in dem viel gelacht wird
Grosser Freiraum für eigene Ideen und Kreativität
Unterstützung für die eigene fachliche Weiterentwicklung
Interessante Anstellungsbedingungen
Legendäre Team-Event’s sowie Töggeliturniere




Was dir dein Job bietet

In dieser Hybrid-Funktion erwartet dich, nebst der ganzheitlichen Betreuung unserer internen IT-Infrastruktur, als Consultant die Rolle des «Trusted Advisory». Du hilfst unseren Kunden, sie mit unseren Lösungen und Knowhow erfolgreich zu machen: Von PreSales bis hin zur Konzeption, Umsetzung (Implementation) und den Betrieb.

Als Junior bieten wir dir durch intensive Begleitung & Trainings die einmalige Chance, mit deiner Karriere in der Informatik voll durchzustarten.




Zu deinen Hauptaufgaben gehören:

Als SystemEngineer

Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung der internen IT-Infrastruktur (Server, Netzwerk, Clients)
Unterstützung im 1st- und 2nd-Level-Support für interne Benutzer
Verwaltung und Überwachung der Serverumgebungen sowie von AD, Microsoft 365 und anderen Cloud-Diensten
Umsetzung von IT-Sicherheitsmaßnahmen, Backups und Automatisierungsprojekten
Dokumentation der IT-Umgebung und Erstellung technischer Anleitungen.

Als Consultant

Begleitung unserer Kunden von PreSales bis hin zum Betrieb
Analyse, Erfassung und Umsetzungen von Kundenanforderungen
Durchführung von Workshops mit verschiedenen Teams
Erarbeitung und Weiterentwicklung von Konzepten und Architekturen
Begleitung bei der Realisierung von Systemen/-Plattformen und deren Integration
Proaktive Beratung des Kunden rund um unsere Lösungen




Was du uns bietest:

Grundkenntnisse moderner IT-Infrastrukturen & Dienste im Enterprise Umfeld
Technisches Flair & gute Auffassungsgabe
Hohe Selbständigkeit und Lösungsorientiertes Denken
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten
Lernbereitschaft und Eigeninitiative
Fliessend in der deutschen Sprache
Der Wille, beim Kunden vor Ort zu arbeiten (falls erforderlich)
Freude an einem dynamischen Arbeitsumfeld (im Team wie auch als Einzelplayer) mit wechselnden Kunden und Projekten

Das verschafft dir einen Vorteil:

Abgeschlossene Lehre und/oder Diplomstudium (HF/FH) in der Informatik
Entsprechende Weiterbildungen/Kurse (CompTIA, MCSE/MCITP, LPI etc.)
Gute Englisch-Kenntnisse
Erfahrungen im Bereich Consulting und/oder der Tätigkeit als SystemEngineer




Noch Fragen?

Nein? Super, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung-

Ansonsten beantwortet dir Claudio gerne deine Fragen.




Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Show more

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Die Abteilung Infrastruktur-Services eines führenden Medienunternehmens ist verantwortlich

für den Betrieb der gesamten zentralen IT-Infrastruktur des Konzerns. In dieser Funktion

sind Sie insbesondere für den Betrieb und die Instandhaltung der Medienrechenzentren des

Unternehmens in einer Großstadt zuständig.




Dein Beitrag

Beratung und Unterstützung von Geschäftsbereichen und verbundenen Unternehmen im Zusammenhang mit Data Center Services
Beteiligung an der Implementierung und Entwicklung der Data Center-Infrastruktur.
Dokumentieren und pflegen der Rechenzentrumsinfrastruktur.
Koordination von Interventionen und Hilfestellungen mit Herstellern (3. Level).
Analyse und Bearbeitung von Vorfällen im Zusammenhang mit Rechenzentren, Druckdiensten sowie verschiedenen Diensten.
Teilnahme an Projekten im Zusammenhang mit der Rechenzentrumsinfrastruktur und den Druckdiensten teil.
Betrieb, Management und Überwachung der Data Center- und Print Services Infrastruktur.




Damit begeisterst

Experte für Rechenzentren mit mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung im Rechenzentrumsmanagement in einem grossen Unternehmen
Informatiker/in FOH oder gleichwertige Ausbildung
Ausgezeichnete Netzwerk- und Sicherheitskenntnisse (Routing, DNS, Proxy, Zertifikat, NAC)
Kenntnisse in Windows Server-Umgebungen, Datenbank (SQL)
Gute Deutsch Kenntnisse, Französisch ist von Vorteil (mündlich und schriftlich)




Damit begeistern wir

Mitgestaltung und Übernahme von Verantwortung in einem inspirierenden Umfeld
Vielfältige Medien- und Kulturlandschaft mit spannenden Perspektiven
Abwechslungsreiche und interessante Tätigkeit in einem dynamischen Umfeld der elektronischen Medien und des Service Public
Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen gemäss GAV, darunter 40-Stunden-Woche, mindestens 27 Ferientage, flexible Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten sowie 18 Wochen Mutterschafts- und 4 Wochen Vaterschaftsurlaub
Show more

Title: Internship IP2TIS 2025 - For students in the field of Environment and Sustainability, data science or computer science
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love.

That’s what makes us Roche.

Our Global Internship Programme in Innovation & Sustainability (#IP2TIS) offers a unique opportunity for passionate individuals to gain hands-on experience in the pharmaceutical industry while making a positive impact on the world.

Are you ready to join a global network spanning 20+ countries, where bright minds collaborate to tackle real-world challenges in Innovation & Sustainability? Do you want to work on impactful projects, shape the future, and drive change from within?

The Opportunity

At Group Safety, Security, Health and Environment, we have regulatory obligations to report on environmental sustainability metrics internally and externally. Simultaneously, we are developing strategies to mitigate Roche's environmental impact. To support these efforts, we need robust data management, governance, and insights that will help us meet our reporting obligations, drive decision-making, and build data and digital strategies.

To improve data management, we are establishing data pipelines that automate the collection and reporting of these metrics, following the data mesh methodology and creating data products. This approach unlocks the potential for advanced analytics by building FAIR data (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable) that we can trust. The scope of the internship is to focus on environmental metrics, particularly waste data, and support the creation and management of data products.

This internship position is located in Basel, on site/hybrid.

Who You Are

You are enrolled or have completed your Master’s studies at a university, preferably in the field of data science, environmental science, computer science or a combination thereof, within the last 12 months and are interested in applying your knowledge in a modern working environment as part of an internship of at least 3 months and getting to know the pharmaceutical industry.

Furthermore, you are


Highly motivated to change the way Roche collects, manages and reports environmental data
Able to work independently and achieve results
Have strong analytical skills
Have an understanding of data products and data mesh (preferred)


If you meet most but not all qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.

Technical details

The start date for the internship is between 1st and 16th of July 2025

More information about the program you can find on go.roche.com/ip2tis_25.

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Basel is the headquarters of the Roche Group and one of its most important centres of pharmaceutical research. Over 10,700 employees from over 100 countries come together at our Basel/Kaiseraugst site, which is one of Roche`s largest sites. Read more.

Besides extensive development and training opportunities, we offer flexible working options, 18 weeks of maternity leave and 10 weeks of gender independent partnership leave. Our employees also benefit from multiple services on site such as child-care facilities, medical services, restaurants and cafeterias, as well as various employee events.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: System Engineer
Description:
Bist Du ein Macher-Typ, eigeninitiativ und bereit für eine neue, spannende Herausforderung als System Engineer?




Für unseren Kunden suchen wir eine proaktive Persönlichkeit, die sich in einem innovativen, wachsenden und nach dem DevSecOps-Modell organisierten Projekt-Umfeld wohlfühlt und etwas bewegen möchte.




Der C5I-Campus spiegelt einen Innovationsraum im sicherheitspolitischen Umfeld mit hochattraktiven Arbeitsplätzen für rund 200 Mitarbeitende – direkt an der Aare gelegen. Hier bietet sich talentierten Persönlichkeiten die Möglichkeit, in einer agilen Arbeitsumgebung mit Startup-Charakter zu wirken.




Möchtest Du Deine Ideen und Dein Know-how einbringen und Dich mit dem Team für die gemeinsame Vision engagieren? Dann melde Dich! Wir freuen uns auf Deinen CV via dieses Portal oder Deine Kontaktaufnahme per E-Mail an recruiting@dietrichconsulting.ch mit dem Betreff „System Engineer”.




Dein Tätigkeitsfeld

Mitwirken an der Planung und Umsetzung von Systemlösungen und Architekturentscheidungen
Verantworten des gesamten Lifecycles von Systemen – von der Plattformentwicklung bis zum Betrieb
Arbeiten mit Kubernetes und Container-Orchestrierung, um stabile, skalierbare Systeme zu gewährleisten
Mitwirken in Data Center Automation
Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung von Virtualisierungsplattformen und Hyperconverged Systemen
Pflegen der systemtechnischen Dokumentationen




Dein Profil

Studienabschluss in Informatik oder eine abgeschlossene Berufslehre als Informatiker/in EFZ bzw. Quereinsteiger/in mit relevanter Berufserfahrung
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Virtualisierungs-/Containertechnologien wie Kubernetes und VMware
Kenntnisse in der Skripterstellung
Erfahrung in CI/CD Pipelines und Automatisierung mit Terraform oder Ansible
Erfahrung im Windows und/oder Linux Bereich sowie Netzwerktechnologien
Selbständige, lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise mit hohem Verantwortungsbewusstsein
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse, Französisch- und Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil
Show more
